2025-06-11期



韩服冒险岛公告


(수정) 6/12(목) 넥슨 정기점검 안내


你好, 넥슨 고객 여러분.

매주 목요일은 넥슨 정기점검으로 6월 12일(목) 오전 3시부터 오전 8시까지
넥슨 로그인이 원활하지 않습니다.

 
고객 여러분들의 너그러운 양해 부탁드리며
자세한 점검시간과 작업영향은 아래 내용을 확인해 주시기 바랍니다.

▣ 점검시간과 작업영향(수정)

- 오전 3시 ~ 오전 8시(5시간)
: 넥슨 로그인이 원활하지 않습니다.
: 회원 가입이 원활하지 않습니다.
: 넥슨캐시 충전/조회/사용/전환이 원활하지 않습니다.
: 상점 서비스 이용이 원활하지 않습니다.
: 쿠폰 서비스 이용이 원활하지 않습니다.
: 직접 결제 서비스 이용이 원활하지 않습니다.

- 오전 7시 ~ 오전 9시(2시간)
: 게임코인 서비스 이용이 원활하지 않습니다.

안내 드리는 내용 참고하셔서 이용에 불편 없으시길 바랍니다.

谢谢.

[점검예정] 6/12(목) 메이플스토리 홈페이지 점검 안내(09:00~10:00)



你好. 勇士们!

단풍마을의 평온함을 위해 힘쓰고 있는 GM소리입니다.

 

메이플스토리 홈페이지 점검이 예정되어 안내드립니다.



[작업 일시]

2025년 6월 12일(목) 오전 9시 ~ 10시 (1시간)


[작업 내역]

1) 메이플스토리 홈페이지 점검 

※ 게임은 정상적으로 이용 가능합니다.



원활하고 즐거운 메이플스토리를 만들기 위해 더욱 노력하겠습니다.



GM索莉奉上


东南亚服冒险岛公告


[Completed] Minor Patch and Cash Shop Update on 11th June 2025


10 Jun 2025

[Completed] Minor Patch and Cash Shop Update on 11th June 2025


[Update as of 11th June 2025, 1330hrs]

Game services have resumed as of 1330hrs.


Minor Patch


  • Game Client Version: v242.3
  • Size: ~154 MB
  • A Minor Patch has been included in this maintenance.
  • You are recommended to launch your Game Client to run the Auto Patcher.
  • For the list of known and fixed issues, please refer to them HERE.

    [Update as of 11th June 2025, 1250hrs]

    Dear Maplers,

    As we have encountered some unforeseen technical difficulties, the maintenance period will need to be extended until 1400hrs.
    We apologise for the inconvenience.

    We seek your patience and understanding.
    - MapleSEA Administrator


    Dear Maplers,

    Please be informed that there will be a scheduled Minor Patch maintenance on 11th June 2025.
    During this period, services undergoing maintenance will be temporarily unavailable.

    Game Maintenance
  • Maintenance Period: 11th June 2025, 0900hrs ~ 1300hrs
  • Affected Service(s): MapleStorySEA game servers
  • Impact: All MapleStorySEA game servers will be unavailable
    •   ↪ Game services for all worlds will not be available during the stipulated time. Kindly log out before this period to avoid disruptions to your gameplay.

    Update Preview
  • Cash Shop Update details for 11th June 2025 can be found here.
  • Hyper Miracle Time for ALL Equipments will be held on 14th June 2025. Details can be found here.

    • Thank you.

    - MapleSEA Administrator
     

    v242 Known Issues and Fixed Issues (Updated 11th June 2025, 1330hrs)


    04 Jun 2025

    v242 Known Issues and Fixed Issues (Updated 11th June 2025, 1330hrs)




    Dear Maplers,
    Please refer to the update notice for information regarding each patch's issues and updates.

    Last Update: 11th June 2025, 1330hrs



    Resolved Issues


    11th June 2025 - Minor Patch V242.3


  • Fixed an issue where Salvific Scroll for Pet Equip. ATT 100% became durational upon dropped to the ground.
  • Fixed an issue where quest items were not dropping when certain Singapore map related quests were accepted.
  • Fixed an issue where certain dialogue in Meso Market contains text error.
  • Fixed an issue where Summon Jaguar VI was shown in HEXA Matrix UI.
  • Fixed an issue where Trace of Darkness requirement for general's afterimage quest was not filled up even if Black Mage was defeated between 4th June 2025, 0000hrs to 4th June 2025, before maintenance.
  • Fixed an issue regarding the usage of Platinum Scissors of Karma.

    • 6th June 2025 - Minor Patch V242.2


  • An error where Lucid's Earring special skill is not reflected on the Skill UI has been fixed.
  • An error where Ignition Ring special skill is not reflected on the Skill UI has been fixed.
  • An issue where Zero's combat skills contain unintentional delay between tagging Alpha and Beta has been fixed.
  • An issue where the wrong world icon is displayed on the Cross World Maple Auction has been fixed.
  • An issue where Cadena's Chain Artz: Stroke VI skill cannot be cancelled has been fixed.
  • An issue where Striker's Crashing Wave skill cannot be cancelled has been fixed.
  • An issue where Evan's 2nd Hit of Circle of Mana VI does not deal damage if the skill is used in quick succession has been fixed.
  • Fixed "I Understand Completely" Medal description error.
  • Fixed text error on certain Epic Dungeon dialogue.
  • Adjusted the display of the Preset Numbering for the Hotkey Settings.
  • Corrected the date format of the World Map Teleport message.
  • Corrected the slot bonus tooltip on Cross World Maple Auction.

    • 5th June 2025 Hot Fixes


  • An error where existing Auction House listings before the patch cannot be claimed or are missing has been fixed.


    • 4th June 2025 Hot Fixes


  • Victoria Cup Main Stadium can now be accessed via the Event List. Coin Shops will be accessible at the Main Stadium until 8th June 2025, 2359hrs.
  • An issue where Authentic Force monsters are dropping untradeable Sol Erda Fragment items has been fixed.
  • An error where Damage Skin - NEXT Action (Unit) causes the game client to crash has been fixed.



    • Current Known Issues


    Thank you to Maplers who reported issue(s) listed below.

    4th June 2025


  • An error where Lucid's Earring special skill is not reflected on the Skill UI being investigated.
  • An error where Ignition Ring special skill is not reflected on the Skill UI being investigated.
  • An error in the usage of Platinum Scissors of Karma.
  • An issue where Zero's combat skills contain unintentional delay between tagging Alpha and Beta.



    • - MapleSEA Administrator
     

    国际服冒险岛公告


    v.260 - Stargazer Patch Notes


    Get ready to Wish Upon a Shooting Star, because Sia Astelle has descended from the mystical land of Oort! With the power of the Erda Link, she’s not just swinging from the chandelier, she’s swinging all the way down to Maple World bringing the constellations to life! Start your journey with Hyper Burning MAX and level up faster than ever, then dance with the stars at the Morning Star Banquet. When you're ready for the ultimate challenge, step into Challenger World, where the only limit is how you choose to align your stars. The universe is yours to shape, how will you Shine?

    TABLE OF CONTENTS

    v.260 - Stargazer is coming soon on June 11th!

    NEW CONTENT

    New Job: Sia Astelle

    Sia Astelle, the Star Guardian of the constellations has descended from Oort into Maple World! Her mission is to gather the scattered constellations and restore cosmic harmony. Play as Sia Astelle now and embark on her celestial adventures!

    Quick Overview

    Class Shine
    Job Magician
    Primary Stat INT
    Secondary Stat LUK
    Legion Bonus Abnormal Status Damage
    (+1% / +2% / +3% / +5% / +6%)
    Primary Weapon Celestial Light
    Secondary Weapon Compass
    Link Skill
    Tree of Stars
    Passive
    Mastery Level: 3
    Buff Duration: +10%, Critical Damage: +3%

    Sia Astelle Equipment

    Primary Weapon: Celestial Light

    Image Item Required Level
    		Stardust Celestial Light 1
    		Shining Celestial Light 10
    		Starry Celestial Light 30
    		Ignited Celestial Light 50

    Sia Astelle Skills

    Sia Astelle is a Job focused focused on executing skill combos to unleash the power of the constellations themselves. She also has a variety of buffs and passive abilities to support her damage and survivability. Her gameplay focuses on using her Marking skills to build combos that trigger powerful Constellation skills.

    • Marking Skills
      When these types of skills are used, they will automatically get recorded on the Stellagram. You can record up to 4 Marking skills at a time.
    • Constellation Skills
      These skills activate based on the combo of the Marking skills recorded. The combo you use will determine which Constellation skills you unleash!

    Beginner Skills

    Skill Description
    Return to Oort
    Active
    		 Returns you to Oort.
    Starry Wave
    Active
    		 Descend slowly by gliding upon starlight.
    Stellar Equalize
    Buff
    		 Increases the Attack Power and Magic ATT of all nearby characters.
    Stellar Marking
    Buff
    		 Activate Stellar Marking to record skills on the Stellagram and fuse Constellations based on the recorded skill combinations.

    1st Job Skills

    Skill Description
    Ray
    Marking
    		 Fires a lance of starlight in front of you and records Ray on the Stellagram.
    Stellar I - Antares
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Antares fusion to summon one of Antares' rabbit holes where it periodically pulls in nearby enemies and deals continuous damage.
    Starlight
    Active
    		 When Starlight is toggled, an additional attack is made upon attacking or when a Constellation Skill is activated.
    Starry Flow
    Active
    		 Teleport a set distance to other locations on the same map using the arrow keys.
    Starry Leap
    Active
    		 Allows you to jump a greater distance into the air.
    Astral Magic Guard
    Passive
    		 Decrease damage taken and transfer some damage received. Permanently increases defense.
    Astral Movement
    Passive
    		 Permanently increases Magic ATT, Speed, Max Speed, and Jump.

    2nd Job Skills

    Skill Description
    Boom
    Marking
    		 Explodes with starlight and records Boom on the Stellagram.
    Stellar II - Algol
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Algol fusion to summon Algol as a lizard where it tracks and charges towards nearby enemies within a set area.
    Celestial Alignment
    Buff
    		 Temporarily increases Critical Damage.
    Oort Wave
    Passive
    		 Permanently increases INT, Damage, and Attack Speed.
    Astral Force
    Passive
    		 Permanently increases Magic Mastery, Magic ATT, INT, and Attack Speed.
    Astral Energy
    Passive
    		 Permanently increases Max MP and absorbs the enemy’s MP when attacking with Magic skills.
    Starlight Enhancement I
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Bolster the power of the Star Guardian to summon greater starlight and enhance the Starlight Damage.

    3rd Job Skills

    Skill Description
    Pole
    Marking
    		 Summons a tower of starlight dealing damage over time to nearby enemies and records Pole on the Stellagram.
    Stellar III - Alchiba
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Alchiba fusion to temporarily gain the Witch’s Protection buff, increasing Ignore Defense.
    Stellar IV - Bellatrix
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Bellatrix fusion to temporarily gain the Bellatrix buff, activating Starlight Link at your location at set intervals.
    Stellar V - Fomalhaut
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Fomalhaut fusion to summon Fomalhaut as a horned conch where it spins around you and damages nearby enemies for a set amount of time.
    Starry Boost
    Active
    		 When Starry Boost is toggled, the maneuverability and distance of starlight increases.
    Astral Elements
    Passive
    		 Permanently Increases Magic ATT, Critical Rate, Critical Damage.
    Astral Invincibility
    Passive
    		 Permanently increases Knockback Resistance, Status Resistance, and Elemental Resistance.
    Stellar Enhancement I
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Strengthens your connection to the stars and increases the intensity of the starlight you can summon.
    Starlight Enhancement II
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Bolster the power of the Star Guardian to summon greater starlight and enhance the Starlight Damage.

    4th Job Skills

    Skill Description
    Link
    Marking
    		 Lights up the sky with refractive starlight and records Link on the Stellagram.
    Stellar VI - Izar
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Izar fusion to summon 3 blades that orbit around you, dealing damage and tracking nearby enemies for a set duration.
    Stellar VII - Vega
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Vega fusion to summon a Starlit Gust, dealing damage to nearby enemies and grants the Starlight Wings buff. When the Starlight Wings buff is active, enemies around you will be attacked periodically.
    Stellar VIII - Sadalmelik
    Buff
    		 Complete the Sadalmelik fusion to temporarily gain the Sadalmelik buff, granting invincibility and decreasing the damage taken.
    Appear
    Buff
    		 Increase the Final Damage for a set amount of time.
    Pulse
    Buff
    		 Hones your resolve to ignore certain abnormal status effects.
    Maple Warrior
    Passive
    		 The Goddess of Maple World’s grace increases your stats.
    Astral Assimilation
    Passive
    		 Permanently increases Magic Mastery, Magic ATT, Critical Rate, and Critical Damage.
    Astral Infinity
    Passive
    		 Permanently increases Damage, Boss Damage, and Knockback Resistance.
    Empowered Ray
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Fires a lance of starlight in front of you and records Ray on the Stellagram.
    Enhanced Boom
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Explodes with starlight and records Boom on the Stellagram.
    Stellar Enhancement II
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Strengthens your connection to the stars and increases the intensity of the starlight you can summon.
    Starlight Enhancement III
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Bolster the power of the Star Guardian to summon greater starlight and enhance the Starlight Damage.

    Hyper Skills

    Passive Skills

    Skill Description
    Marking - Reinforce
    Passive
    		 Increases the damage of Marking Skills.
    Marking - Extra Strike
    Passive
    		 Increase the number of attacks for Marking Skills.
    Marking - Persist
    Passive
    		 Increases the duration of Pole and HP recovery of Link.
    Stellar Marking - Enhance
    Passive
    		 Activates an additional Starlight Link when a Constellation Skill is activated.
    Stellar Marking - Reinforce Duration
    Passive
    		 Increases the damage of Constellation Skills.
    Stellar - Harden
    Passive
    		 Imbues your body with celestial starlight, permanently reducing damage taken.
    Appear - Enhance
    Passive
    		 Increases the Final Damage of Appear.
    Appear - Persist
    Passive
    		 Permanently increases Appear’s buff duration.
    Appear - Cooldown Cutter
    Passive
    		 Decreases the cooldown of Appear.

    Active Skills

    Skill Description
    Stellar IX - Canopus
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Canopus fusion to temporarily summon Canopus as an anchor, dealing continuous damage to nearby enemies.
    Stellar X - Capella
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Capella fusion to temporarily receive the Light of Capella buff, increasing Critical Damage and Critical Rate.
    Observe
    Buff
    		 Borrows power by watching the stars to increase Damage for a period of time.

    5th Job Skills (V Matrix)

    Sia Astelle 5th Job Skills

    Skill Description
    Shine
    Marking
    		 Lights up the sky with refractive starlight and records Shine on the Stellagram.
    Stellar XI - Sirius
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Sirius fusion to summon Sirius as a wolf, dealing damage to nearby enemies.
    Stellar XII - Sadalsuud
    Constellation
    		 Complete the Sadalsuud fusion to temporarily summon Sadalsuud as an hourglass then explodes with great force.
    Time Binder
    Active
    		 Bind the flow of time, immobilizing enemies within range.
    Savior’s Circle
    Buff
    		 Combines the power of the twelve constellations to create a strength greater than any star alone.

    Sia Astelle Boost Nodes

    Skill Description
    Ray
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Ray.
    Boom
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Boom.
    Pole
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Pole.
    Starlight
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Starlight.
    Stellar I - Antares
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Stellar I - Antares.
    Stellar II - Algol
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Stellar II - Algol.
    Stellar V - Fomalhaut
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Stellar V - Fomalhaut.
    Stellar VI - Izar
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Stellar VI - Izar.

    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Stellar VII - Vega.

    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Stellar IX - Canopus.

    Common 5th Job Skill Nodes

    Skill Description
    Rope Lift
    Active
    		 Fires a grappling hook to a platform above you to ascend quickly.
    Decent Mystic Door
    Active
    		 Creates a portal to the closest town.
    Decent Sharp Eyes
    Active
    		 Locates an enemy’s weak spot to deal lethal damage.
    Decent Hyper Body
    Active
    		 Increases Max HP and Max MP.
    Decent Combat Orders
    Active
    		 Temporarily increases all of your skill levels.
    Decent Advanced Blessings
    Active
    		 Increase ATT, Magic ATT, Defense, Max HP, and Max MP. Only the highest effect from Bless, Advanced Blessing, or Decent Advanced Blessing will be applied.
    Decent Speed Infusion
    Active
    		 Increase your attack speed by 1. Only the highest effect from either Speed Infusion or Decent Speed Infusion will be applied.
    Blink
    Active
    		 Teleports you to a random location on the map.
    Erda Nova
    Active
    		 Gather Erda from yourself and your surroundings to explode enemies. Disrupts the Erda of your targets, binding their movements.
    Will of Erda
    Active
    		 Hones your resolve to ignore certain abnormal status effects.
    Decent Holy Symbol
    Active
    		 Temporarily gain extra EXP and items when hunting monsters. Does not stack with Holy Symbol.
    Erda Shower
    Active
    		 Fires a blast of compressed Erdas at nearby enemies.
    Maple World Goddess’s Blessing
    Active
    		 The Maple World Goddess’s Blessing increases all stats and damage.
    Decent Holy Fountain
    Active
    		 Summon a Holy Fountain that restores party members’ HP.
    Mana Overload
    Active
    		 Increases your attack skills by overloading the mana flowing through you.
    Ethereal Form
    Active
    		 Moves you to a different dimension to reduce the damage you take.

    6th Job Skills (Erda Link)

    Skill Description
    Celestial Design
    Active
    		 Explodes with the primordial starlight that once heralded the birth of creation, dealing heavy damage. Stuns all enemies including those normally immune to stun. Grants invincibility while casting.
    SHINE Ray/Stellar I - Antares
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Ray and Stellar I - Antares.
    Shine Boost
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Shine.
    Savior’s Circle Boost
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Savior’s Circle.
    Stellar XI - Sirius Boost
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Stellar XI - Sirius.
    Stellar XII - Sadalsuud
    Upgraded Passive
    		 Boosts Stellar XII - Sadalsuud.

    Note: The maximum number of character slots has been increased from 57 to 58.

    Do you Sia this?

    New Area: Oort

    A new area has appeared, Oort, home of Sia Astelle! Explore this mysterious realm, meet new faces, fight new enemies, and discover where Sia Astelle comes from as you follow her story.

    • Explore Oort and discover the following new maps:

    Back to Top

    Erda Link

    Erda Link is a new system introduced with the 6th Job Advancement for Sia Astelle. This system enhances character progression through a Runestone Node tree, where activating and enhancing stones boosts stats, empowers existing skills, and unlocks powerful new ones.

    Erda Link UI Overview

    • To access the Erda Link UI, open the Skill UI, select the 6th Job Skill Tab, then click the ‘Erda Link’ button. The UI includes:
      • A Runestone Node tree where stones can be activated and enhanced.
      • A section displaying SHINE Stones.
      • A list of currently owned Sol Erda and Sol Erda Fragments
      • A preview panel showing detailed information about the selected stone.
      • A toggle button to view Light Power.
      • A button to access the Sol Erda Conversion UI.
    • All stats gained through Erda Link can be viewed by clicking the ‘See Stats’ button.

    Types of Stones

    • Stones are activated and enhanced using Sol Erda and Sol Erda Fragments.
    • There are five main types of Stones within the Erda Link Stone tree that can be activated:
      • Origin Stone
        • After completing the 6th Job Advancement, the Origin Stone is automatically activated.
        • Can be enhanced up to Level 30.
        • Unlock additional effects at Levels 10, 20, and 30.
      • Ultimate Stone
        • Enhances 4th Job and lower skills.
        • Can be enhanced up to Level 30.
        • Requires the boosted skill in the V Matrix to be Lv. 40 to unlock the Ultimate Stone. Enhanced slots do not count toward this requirement.
        • Requires Light Power to be activated.
      • Skill Stone
        • Enhances 5th Job skills.
        • Activate Common Skills through Skill Stones, such as Sol Janus.
        • Can be enhanced up to Level 30 through one of the following methods:
          • Enhance twice by 15 levels.
          • Enhance directly to Level 30 at once.
        • Requires the 5th Job Skill Node to be Lv. 25 to unlock the Skill Stone. Enhanced slots do not count toward this requirement.
        • Requires all connected Rush Stones to be activated before it becomes available.
      • Boost Stone
        • Grants bonus effects when specific activation conditions are met.
        • Cannot be enhanced.
        • Require Light Power to be activated.
      • Rush Stone
        • Provides bonus stats.
        • Cannot be enhanced.
        • Becomes available when the previous connected stone is activated.
    • Stones that do not meet activation or enhancement requirements will have the Activate Stone or Enhance Stone button disabled, with a tooltip explaining the unlock conditions when hovered over.
    • Stones that meet the requirements will glow and the corresponding button will be enabled.
    • Activating a stone unlocks new paths, and connected branches will light up.

    Light Power

    • Light Power is required to activate certain standalone stones such as Boost Stones and Ultimate Stones.
    • Light Power expands with each activation, except in cases where stones require multiple connected activations and conditions to unlock.
    • Click the ‘Light Power’ toggle to display the current range of Light Power.
    • When Light Power overlaps with a stone that can be activated, a message will appear:

    SHINE Stone

    • SHINE stones are special stones that provide additional stats and can be enhanced up to Level 20.
    • Starting at Level 11, enhancements may fail and can cause the stone’s level to decrease.
    • SHINE Stones are activated and enhanced using Sol Erda, Sol Erda Fragments, and mesos.
    • Each SHINE Stone has specific activation requirements that must be met before it can be activated:
    SHINE Stone Activation Requirement Stats Enhanced
    1 Activate 1 Ultimate Stone Main Stat
    Boss Damage
    2 Activate 2 Skill Stones Magic Attack
    Ignored Enemy Defense
    3 Activate 2 Boost Stones
    Reach Lv. 270    		 Damage
    Critical Damage
    4 SHINE Stone Enhancement Lv. 10+ Main Stat
    Boss Damage
    5 Coming soon in a future update!
    6 Coming soon in a future update!

    Back to Top

    Wish Upon a Shooting Star

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 20 and above Sia Astelle characters.

    The stars are aligning to guide you forward on your Maple journey. As you follow the path of the shooting stars, you’ll collect wishes that grant powerful rewards!

    How to Participate

    • As Sia Astelle, select ‘Wish Upon a Shooting Star’ from the Event List UI and click ‘Participate’ to start.
      • Alternatively, you can start by accepting the ‘[Wish Upon a Shooting Star] Lead Wish’ quest and talking to Sirius located in Oort.
    • Use the ‘Wish Upon a Shooting Star’ button in the event list to track your event progress at any time!
    • The event UI is split into two sections:
      • Wishes of Progress: Level-based progression rewards
      • Wishes of Style: Fashion and cosmetic rewards.

    Wishes of Progress

    • For Wishes of Progress, you’ll earn rewards as you reach level milestones throughout the event. There are two types of rewards available:
      • Basic Rewards
      • Premium Pass Rewards
    • The Premium Pass can be purchased for 25,000 Maple Points where you can receive additional rewards and special perks:
      • Premium Pass Rewards
      • Access to the Premium Login Event
      • Hunting Perks:
        • +50% Bonus EXP
        • +10% Increased Item Drop Rate
        • Revive in Place Upon Death
      • Note: The Premium Pass can only be purchased once per account. The additional rewards and special perks only apply to the Sia Astelle character that purchased the Premium Pass and are not shared with other characters within the account.
    • Complete specific level milestones within each constellation to unlock additional rewards. There are three constellations to complete:
      • Alchiba
      • Formalhaut
      • Sadalmelik
    Level Basic Reward Quantity Premium Pass Reward Quantity

    Back to Top

    NEW UPDATES

    Skill Sequence System

    Tired of writing an entire essay in MLA format INCLUDING citations before bursting? With the brand new Skill Sequence System, you can bid farewell to the countless times you've said "Wait I need to setup real quick" because in just one press, you're ready to send it!

    • To access the Skill Sequence UI, open the Skill UI and click the ‘Sequence’ button.
    • To create a sequence, click on a sequence row and select the skills you want to add to your lineup.
    • You can customize the sequence layout by clicking ‘Layout Settings’ and creating up to 10 rows, each with its own hotkey. That’s 10 different sequences!
    • Name your sequence by clicking the ‘Sequence Name Settings’ button and the name will be displayed on the hotkey.

    • Toggle ‘Sequence Notifier’ to display icons of used skills on your screen during a sequence.
    • When you press a sequence hotkey, skills will activate in order from left to right at set intervals.
      • Skill effects will display if intervals are set, otherwise effects appear immediately (buffs)
    • The Skill Sequence hotkey displays the longest remaining cooldown of all registered skills. While the cooldown timer is visible, when there is a skill registered to a sequence that can be used, only that skill will be used upon activating the sequence.
    • When a sequence is activated:
      • Skills with active cooldowns or reuse features will not be used.
      • Skills that cannot be used due to insufficient gauge, MP, or other reasons will be skipped, with a system message indicating the reason.
      • If used in the air, skills that cannot be used in the air will be skipped.
      • the sequence will ignore any Abnormal Status effects—gaining one afterward won’t stop the sequence.
    • Skills registered to interaction keys (like arrow keys) won’t respond during sequence activation. For example, Burning Soul Blade assigned to down arrow will stay fixed and won’t summon in the sequence.
    • Skills with Action Customization will operate based on their command/on-off status. For example, Jaguar Storm will only summon Jaguars if turned on during the sequence.

    Back to Top

    Skill Improvements and Changes

    Common Skill Improvements and Bug Fixes

    • Resolved an issue where Adele was unable to use the Advanced Giant Potion immediately after activating a Ruin.
    • Resolved an issue where only one debuff among Monkey Fury, Flashbang, and Unicorn Spike was applied.
    • Resolved an issue where some 6th Job skills were missing from the Skill UI when resetting 1st to 4th Job skills.
    • Increased the attack range of Fury of the Wild by approximately 30%.
    • Mastery Node
      • Resolved an issue where the skill level appeared awkward in the description when the Mastery Node is deactivated from using a SP Reset Scroll.
      • Resolved an issue where the deactivation message appeared when enhancing a node when the Mastery Node was inactive.
    • Resolved an issue where the buff icons remained visible even after summons disappeared for the following skills:
      • Decent Holy Fountain
      • Holy Fountain
      • Obsidian Barrier (Burst/Torrent)
      • Drill Salvo
      • HEXA Drill Salvo
    • Resolved an issue where Decent Sharp eyes were being used repeatedly in pet auto-buffs.
    • Resolved an issue where the Skill Notifier did not appear when cooldowns were over for the following skills:
        • Roll of the Dice
        • Grandis Goddess’s Blessing.
        • Buccaneer: Roll of the Dice, Double Down
        • Corsair: Scurvy Summons, Roll of the Dice, Double Down, HEXA Scurvy Summons
        • Cannoneer: Roll of the Dice, Double Down
        • Thunder Breaker: Gale, Typhoon
        • Mechanic: Roll of the Dice, Double Down
    • Resolved an issue where the skill effect transparency did not apply properly for the following skills:
      • Explorer Pirate: Pirate's Banner
      • Explorer Magician: Infinity
      • Hero: Flash Blade, Instinctual Combo
      • Dark Knight: Spear of Darkness
      • Arch Mage (Ice/Lightning): Frost Ward
      • Bishop: Genesis, Heaven's Door
      • Marksman: Ultimate Snipe
      • Night Lord: Frailty Curse
      • Shadower: Meso Explosion, Assassinate, Trickblade
      • Buccaneer: Serpent Scale, Serpent Vortex, Unleash Neptunus
      • Corsair: The Dreadnought
      • Cannoneer: Cannon Barrage, The Nuclear Option
      • Dawn Warrior: Flicker, Flare Slash
      • Blaze Wizard: Orbital Flame
      • Thunder Breaker: Tidal Crash, Ascension, Thunder, Lightning God Spear Strike, Lightning Spear Multistrike
      • Aran: Return to Rien, Adrenaline Overload: Golden Burst, Final Beyond Blade - White Tiger, Finisher - Adrenaline Surge
      • Evan: Mana Burst, Return Flash, Wind Circle, Return Dive, Thunder Circle, Earth Circle, Return Flame, Ludicrous Speed, Zodiac Burst
      • Mercedes: Final Attack: Dual Bowguns, Rising Rush, Aerial Barrage, Unicorn Spike, Gust Dive, Leaf Tornado, Lightning Edge, Rolling Moonsault, Spikes Royale, Spirit of Elluel, Sylvidia's Flight
      • Phantom: Rapier Wit, Penombre
      • Luminous: Liberation Orb, Endless Darkness, Eternal Light
      • Demon Slayer: Dark Thrust, Cerberus Chomp, Demon Awakening
      • Demon Avenger: Exceed: Demon Strike, Nether Slice, Blood Prison
      • Blaster: Rocket Punch, Afterimage Shock
      • Battle Mage: Battle Burst
      • Wild Hunter: Call of the Hunter, White Heat Rush, Hunting Assistant Unit, Drill Salvo
      • Mechanic: Homing Beacon, AP Salvo Plus
      • Xenon: Diagonal Chase
      • Kaiser: Dragon Barrage
      • Kain: Shadow Step
      • Cadena: Muscle Memory, Muscle Memory Finale
      • Zero: Flash Assault, Ego Weapon, Shadow Flash
      • Kinesis: Ultimate - Trainwreck, Ultimate - Psychic Shockwave
      • Adele: Impale, Resonance Rush
      • Illium: Reaction - Destruction, Reaction - Domination, Crystal Skill - Vortex of Light, Crystal Skill - Resonance, Crystal Skill - Wings of Glory, Longinus Spear, Crystal Ignition
      • Khali: Hex: Chakram Split, Hex: Pandemonium, Void Burst
      • Ark: Unstoppable Impulse, Tenacious Instinct, Grievous Wound, Scarlet Charge Drive, Gust Charge Drive, Insatiable Hunger, Boundless Horror, Endlessly Starving Beast
      • Lara: Eruption: Sunrise Well, Eruption: Whirlwind, Land's Connection
      • Hoyoung: Sage: Three Paths Apparition

    Job Skill Improvements and Bug Fixes

    • Hero
      • Final Attack
        • Changed so that Final Attack prioritizes attacking the enemy with the highest max HP first.
      • Advanced Final Attack
        • Changed so that Advanced Final Attack prioritizes attacking the enemy with the highest max HP first.
      • Cry Valhalla
        • Resolved an issue where the same sound effect was played for all sword strikes.
      • HEXA Puncture
        • Resolved an issue with the skill effects volume.
      • HEXA Beam Blade
        • Resolved an issue where the Skill Notifier wasn’t displaying.
    • Paladin
      • Falling Justice
        • Decreased the damage at Lv. 30 from 1560% to 1491%.
        • Changed Falling Justice so that it is now affected by cooldown reduction effects.
      • Sacred Bastion
        • Resolved an issue where the skills cooldown was not applied correctly.
    • Dark Knight
      • Final Attack
        • Changed so that Final Attack triggers when Speak of Darkness hits.
      • Revenge of the Evil Eye
        • Added Revenge of the Evil Eye to the Battle Analysis System UI.
      • HEXA Evil Eye Shock
        • Resolved an issue where the skill could be used consecutively.
    • Arch Mage (Fire, Poison)
      • Meteor Shower
        • Decreased the delay before Teleport can be used again after casting Meteor Shower.
      • Creeping Toxin, HEXA Creeping Toxin
        • Resolved an issue where the toxic pool would sometimes incorrectly summon.
      • HEXA Ignite
        • Resolved an issue where the skill had a delay before it could be used again.
      • Elemental Fury
        • Resolved an issue with the skill effects audio.
    • Arch Mage (Ice, Lightning)
      • Blizzard
        • Decreased the delay before Teleport can be used again after casting Blizzard.
      • HEXA Blizzard
        • Decreased the action delay of HEXA Blizzard by approximately 13%.
        • Decreased the delay before Teleport can be used again after casting HEXA Blizzard.
      • Freezing Crush
        • Resolved an issue where the debuff effect remained even when no stacks were available.
      • Thunder Sphere
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effects were visible in the wrong location for other players.
    • Bishop
      • Divine Protection
        • Improved so that when Unreliable Memory while Divine Protection is active, a system message will indicate the skill cannot be used at the moment.
      • Genesis
        • Decreased the delay before Teleport can be used again after casting Genesis.
      • Heaven’s Door
        • Resolved an issue where the casting effect did not display correctly.
      • Holy Water
        • Resolved an issue where Holy Water would sometimes not grant the holy water effect in certain situations.
      • HEXA Fountain of Vengeance
        • Resolved an issue where the skills effect appeared awkward.
      • Resolved an issue where the skill sequence of Triumph Feather and Blood of the Divine could not be registered through the Skill UI.
      • Resolved an issue where HEXA Triumph Feather could not be triggered by the following skills:
        • HEXA Angelic Wrath
        • HEXA Genesis
        • HEXA Heaven’s Door
    • Bowmaster
      • Extra Quiver
        • Changed where if Extra Quiver has auto-mode activated, it will not activate automatically in towns.
      • Phoenix
        • Changed the attack mechanism.
      • Speed Mirage
        • Decreased the enemy seeking range by approximately 37.5%.
        • Resolved an issue where Speed Mirage gave the afterimage arrow a wider enemy search range than intended.
      • HEXA Phoenix Drive
        • Resolved an issue where the Skill Notifier wasn’t displaying.
    • Marksman
      • Final Attack: Crossbow
        • Changed Final Attack: Crossbow to trigger an additional hit at a certain percentage after landing a direct attack on an enemy.
      • Frostprey
        • Changed the attack mechanism.
    • Pathfinder
      • Shadow Raven
        • Changed the attack mechanism.
        • Increased the attack interval.
      • Relic Charge II
        • Increased the amount of Relic Gauge filled when Shadow Raven attacks from 10 to 30.
      • Curseweaver
        • Changed the debuff effect of Curseweaver.
      • Ancient Astra (Burst)
        • Changed the shooting angle of the first shot of Ancient Astra Burst to be adjustable.
      • Manifest Curse
        • Resolved an issue where Manifest Curse attacks the totem in Especia’s Totem Slash.
      • Resolved an issue where skill descriptions weren’t visible in hotkeys for the following skills:
        • Cardinal Deluge
        • Cardinal Burst
        • Cardinal Torrent
      • Resolved an issue with audio for the following skills:
        • HEXA Combo Assault (Deluge)
        • HEXA Combo Assault (Burst)
        • HEXA Combo Assault (Torrent)
    • Night Lord
      • Dark Flare
        • Added the skill duration to now display as a buff icon that can be canceled by right-clicking.
        • Resolved an issue where Dark Flare could not be registered to Buff Favorites.
      • Darkness Shuriken
        • Resolved an issue where Darkness Shuriken attacks the totem in Especia’s Totem Slash.
      • HEXA Poison: Rampant
        • Resolved an issue where the client would sometimes crash when the skill is used.
    • Shadower
      • Dark Flare
        • Added the skill duration to now display as a buff icon that can be canceled by right-clicking.
      • Shadow Veil
        • Added the skill duration to now display as a buff icon that can be canceled by right-clicking.
      • Slash Shadow Formation
        • Resolved an issue where the skill couldn’t be used while casting HEXA Cruel Stab.
      • Smokescreen
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect appeared awkward.
      • HEXA Assassinate
        • Resolved an issue where damage for HEXA Assassinate would sometimes not apply.
      • HEXA Pulverize
        • Resolved an issue where damage for HEXA Pulverize would sometimes not apply.
    • Dual Blade
      • Sudden Raid
        • Removed the cooldown reduction of Final Cut when using Sudden Raid.
      • Final Cut
        • Decreased the cooldown from 90 seconds to 63 seconds.
      • Haunted Edge
        • Increased the attack range of Haunted Edge-Asura by approximately 8%.
      • Flashbang
        • Changed so that the damage increased against enemies affected by Flashbang’s debuff will now apply to all Dual Blades on the map.
    • Buccaneer
      • Battleship Nautilus
        • Resolved an issue where the Final Attack of Battleship Nautilus only triggered once when Serpent Vortex activated Serpent Fury Mode.
      • Serpent scale
        • Resolved an issue where the casting effect would sometimes display at the wrong time.
      • Corkscrew blow
        • Resolved an issue where HEXA Hook Bomber and HEXA Serpent Scale couldn’t be canceled with Corscrew Blow.
      • Unleash Neptunus
        • Resolved an issue where Unleash Neptunus did not apply the Absolute Stun effect when hitting enemies.
    • Corsair
      • Parrotargetting
        • Changed Parrotargetting’s special shot to fire closer to the character.
        • Changed the casting, hit, and homing effects.
        • Increased the firing range by approximately 25%.
        • Decreased the action delay by approximately 13%.
      • Ugly Bomb
        • Changed so the skill can now be used in the air.
      • Nautilus Strike
        • Changed the skill description.
      • Firing Orders
        • Resolved an issue where Firing Orders would sometimes get placed in awkward locations when in Auto Mode.
        • Resolved an issue where Firing Orders would sometimes bombard enemies that could not be attacked.
        • Resolved an issue where marks were not displayed on enemies when Firing Orders was used in Auto Mode.
      • Scurvy Summons
        • Resolved an issue where the summons did not attack when Eight-Legs Easton was used.
      • All Aboard
        • Resolved an issue where the summons did not attack when Eight-Legs Easton was used.
      • HEXA Rapid Fire
        • Resolved an issue where the Attack Power of Infinity Blast did not apply during HEXA Rapid Fire’s shootout mode.
        • Resolved an issue where the skill sound effect for Shootout Mode continued to play even when the skill ended.
      • HEXA Broadside
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect would not end if the activation conditions were not met.
      • Resolved an issue with the skill effect volume.
        • HEXA brain Scrambler
        • Condemnation
      • HEXA Parrotargetting
        • The skill icon has been updated.
    • Cannoneer
      • HEXA Monkey Militia
        • Increased the summon duration by approximately 3%.
      • Monkey Fury
        • Changed so that the damage increased against affected enemies will now apply to all Cannoneers on the map.
        • Resolved an issue where the Final Attack would sometimes not trigger.
        • Resolved an issue where the damage over time effect was applied individually.
      • Cannon Rainbow
        • Changed the damage formula.
      • Rolling rainbow
        • Resolved an issue where the skill voiceover sometimes did not play.
    • Mihile
      • Light of Courage
        • Resolved an issue where the Final Attack of Light of Courage enhanced with a HEXA node triggered only once.
    • Dawn Warrior
      • Soul Blessing III
        • Increased the Final Damage when a cosmic orb is created at Lv. 10 from 10% to 12%.
      • Student of the Blade
        • Increased the Critical Damage at Lv. 30 from 15% to 20%.
      • Cosmos
        • Increased Damage dealt at Lv. 25 from 1000% to 1100%.
      • Cosmic Burst
        • Resolved an issue where the casting effect appeared awkward for other players.
      • Equinox Power
        • Resolved an issue where MP was not consumed when triggered.
      • Equinox Slash
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect was misaligned.
      • Soul Eclipse
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effects would sometimes disappear after revived.
    • Blaze Wizard
      • Added a feature that allows locking the following skills to prevent them from triggering in the opposite mode when locked:
        • Blaze Wizard’s Blazing Extinction
        • Towering Inferno
        • Savage Flame
        • HEXA Blazing Extinction
      • Fires of Creation
        • Added an Action Customization feature that allows you to summon Flame Fox using the skill key and Blazing Lion using the down arrow key.
      • Inferno Sphere
        • Increased Phoenix Feathers consumption per second when using Inferno Sphere with Flame Fox summoned, doubling the amount and boosting the Final Damage by 100%.
      • Towering Inferno
        • Resolved an issue where using the skill did not summon a Flame Elemental.
    • Night Walker
      • Dark Elemental
        • Increased the duration of Mark of Darkness from 5 seconds to 15 seconds.
        • Resolved an issue where the Marks of Darkness effect would sometimes display awkwardly.
      • Dark Omen
        • Added the skill duration to now display as a buff icon.
        • Added a feature that increases the Shadow bat’s summon duration while active.
        • Improved to allow summoning again even when active summons remain.
        • Changed so the skill can be canceled by right-clicking on your mouse.
        • Increased the duration from 5 seconds to 7 seconds.
        • Increased the cooldown from 20 seconds to 60 seconds.
        • Increased the number of attacks from 1 to 6.
        • Decreased the Damage at Lv. 30 from 500% to 370%.
        • Decreased the maximum number of Shadow Bat summons from 2 to 1.
        • Removed the cooldown reduction of Dark Omen when a dark attribute attack skill hit.
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect appeared awkward when the summons' duration increase effect was applied.
      • HEXA Dark Omen
        • Improved to allow summoning again even when active summons remain.
        • Changed so the skill can be canceled by right-clicking on your mouse.
      • Dominion
        • Resolved an issue where some of the skill effects would awkwardly disappear when Dominion ended.
        • Resolved an issue where Shadow Bat and Ravenous Bat were not continuously summoned while Dominion was active.
      • HEXA Dominion
        • Resolved an issue where Shadow Bat and Ravenous Bat were not continuously summoned while HEXA Dominion was active.
        • Resolved an issue where Shadow Throwing Stars of Silence did not Trigger when HEXA Dominion was used.

      • Resolved an issue where the client would sometimes disconnect when certain skills were used.

      • Permafrost
        • Changed the skill effect.

        • Changed where if Adrenaline Overload is learned, the skill name will be Adrenaline Overload: Iceflow.

        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect sometimes appeared incorrectly.
      • Time Force
        • Resolved an issue where the Time Force could exceed the maximum limit when the DF/TF/Mana Hyper Stat levels were reset.
        • Resolved an issue where Time Force was consumed after HEXA Shadow Rain ended.
      • Resolved an issue where the character movement appeared awkward after casting the following skills:
        • Falling Star
        • Groundbreaker
        • HEXA Falling Star
        • HEXA Groundbreaker
    • Kinesis
      • Kinetic Combo
        • Changed so that Kinetic Combo triggers when an Ultimate skill is used except for:
          • Ultimate - Psychic Shot
          • Ultimate - B.P.M
          • HEXA Ultimate - Psychic Shot
        • Changed to create only one surrounding object regardless of the number of enemies hit.
        • Changed so that the surrounding object prioritizes attacking the enemy with the highest max HP first.
      • Ultimate - Trainwreck
        • Resolved an issue where the skill sound effect played awkwardly when cast consecutively.
    • Adele
      • Resonance Rush
        • Decreased the Damage at Lv. 10 from 502% to 105%.
      • Ascent
        • Decreased the Damage increase effect of Resonance Rush when Ascent is at Lv. 20 from 125% to 115%.
      • Perfection
        • Decreased the Damage increase effect of Resonance Rush when Perfection is at Lv. 30 from 265% to 170%.
      • Reign of Destruction
        • Added the skill duration to now display as a buff icon that can be canceled by right-clicking.
        • Changed the duration for using the skill again after a cooldown reset effect is applied.
      • Legacy Restoration
        • Removed Sol Janus: Dawn from triggering when Legacy Restoration enhanced with a HEXA Node is used.
      • Noble Summons
        • Resolved an issue where the effects of Aether Forge at Lv. 20 and Noble Summons Boost Node were not applied.
      • Aether Bloom
        • Resolved an issue where the effects of Aether Bloom and Blade Torrent Boos Node were not applied.
      • Shardbreaker
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect was not visible to other players.
        • Resolved an issue where Aether Crystal did not spawn after using Shardbreaker.
      • Impale
        • Resolved an issue where Aether Crystal did not spawn after using Impale.
    • Illium
      • Crystalline Bulwark
        • Changed the skill effects transparency options to no longer apply for you and other players.
        • Resolved an issue where the skill could not be activated when using HEXA Longinus Spear.
      • Crystalline Spirit
        • Added a command lock feature to this skill. When used, pressing the skill key without arrow keys will consume all Crystal Shards and place all spirits at once.
      • Mytocrystal Expanse
        • Increased the enemy search range by approximately 178%.
        • Resolved an issue where infinite mytocrystals occasionally did not resonate when using Crystal Ignition.
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect transparency option was not applied to the resonance effect of infinite mytocrystals.
      • Ex
        • Resolved an issue where the skill did not attack normally.
      • Crystal Skill - Deus
        • Resolved an issue where the Satellite did not attack normally.
      • Deploy Crystal
        • Resolved an issue where the buff icon did not disappear when entering a map that removes buffs upon entry and summoning the mytocrystals.
      • Winged Javelin
        • Resolved an issue where Hero’s Will and Will of Erda would sometimes not activate while using Winged Javelin.
      • HEXA Radiant Javelin
        • Resolved an issue where the mytocrystals shard buff icon sometimes didn’t display correctly
      • HEXA Winged Javelin
        • Resolved an issue where the mytocrystals shard buff icon sometimes didn’t display correctly
        • Resolved an issue where the following skills could not be activated when using HEXA Winged Javelin:
          • Terms and Conditions
          • Aeonian Rise
          • Crystalline Bulwark
      • HEXA Longinus
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect appeared awkwardly to other characters.
    • Khali
      • Void Rush
        • Resolved an issue where using Void Rush after Hex: Chakram Sweep would sometimes cancel the backward jump.
      • Resonate & Resonate: Ultimatum
        • Resolved an issue where the effects of Resonate - Range were applied to the enemy reseek range even if the skill was not learned.
      • Death Blossom
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect was not visible to other players.
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect did not change relative to the enemy’s size
      • HEXA Hex: Chakram Split
        • Resolved an issue where chakrams were pushed back by enemy attacks during casting.
    • Ark
      • Vengeful Hate
        • Increased the attack range by approximately 3000%.
      • HEXA Grievous Wound
        • Added a passive effect that increases the damage of HEXA Vengeful Hate.
      • Endless Agony
        • Resolved an issue where casting the skill would display the action as in progress.
      • Resolved an issue where Endlessly Starving Beast’s activation time did not decrease for the following skills:
        • HEXA Grievous Wound
        • HEXA Insatiable Hunger
        • HEXA Unbridled Chaos.
      • Resolved an issue where the following skills appeared awkward in the Combo Key, Key Bindings, and Buff Favorite settings:
        • HEXA Grievous Wound
        • HEXA Insatiable Hunger
        • HEXA Unbridled Chaos.
      • Resolved an issue where the Buff Duration increase effects were not applied to the following skills:
        • HEXA Basic Cast
        • HEXA Scarlet Cast
        • HEXA Gust Cast
        • HEXA Abyssal Cast
    • Lara
      • Unconstrained Dragon Vein
        • Changed the skill description so it can be viewed through the buff icon.
        • Resolved an issue where Unconstrained Dragon Vein’s could not be created in a Town.
      • Eruption: Whirlwind & HEXA Eruption: Whirlwind
        • Resolved an issue where the skill did not attack enemies when a Giant Potion was active.
      • Wakeup Call
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect displayed incorrectly for other players.
        • Resolved an issue where the skill casting effect wasn’t visible to other players.
      • Absorption: River Puddle Douse
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect would sometimes not display.
      • Absorption: Fierce Wind
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect would sometimes not display to other players.
      • Big Stretch
        • Resolved an issue where the skill casting effect wasn’t visible to other players.
        • Resolved an issue where the hit effect did not change relative to the enemy’s size.
    • Hoyoung
      • Scroll: Star Vortex
        • Resolved an issue where sound effects from other skills played when Scroll: Star Vortex was summoned.
      • Scroll: Butterfly Dream
        • Resolved an issue where the skill effect displayed awkwardly.
      • HEXA Scroll: Star Vortex
        • Resolved an issue where the HEXA Node descriptions appeared awkward.
      • HEXA Scroll: Butterfly Dream
        • Resolved an issue where the HEXA Node descriptions appeared awkward.
    • Lynn
      • [Focus] Awaken
        • Changed the Focal Target’s Final Damage to increase by 1% per 2000 INT, up to a maximum of 50%.
        • Decreased the Focal Target’s starting Final Damage buff from 10% to 5%.
        • Decreased the skill duration from 30 seconds to 20 seconds.
      • [Focus] Awaken Boost
        • Decreased the Focal Target’s Final Damage buff from 20% to 10%.

    Back to Top

    Cross World Auction House

    The Auction House has expanded! You can now trade equipment and cash items between worlds!

    • The Auction House will have two regional groupings where specific worlds will share the Auction House.
      • NA Region:
        • Group 1: Scania, Bera, Aurora, Elysium
        • Group 2: Challenger
      • EU Region:
        • Group 1: Luna
        • Group 2: Challenger

    • Use, Set-Up, and ETC items cannot be traded.
    • You cannot purchase items that you have registered yourself.
    • If you buy Use items with the Platinum Scissors of Karma used, they will be claimed as untradable.
    • Cash items purchased at the Auction House are converted to untradable upon claiming, however, some times may still be tradable.
    • Cash items purchased at the Auction House cannot earn Maple Points through rebates.
    • The Purchase All feature is restricted for Cash Items sold from other worlds.
    • When buying items from other worlds, a service fee of 10% of the item cost will be applied. The minimum service fee is 10 Maple Points.
    • Listing items, reclaiming items, and collecting payments are only available in the world where the item was added.
    • Added a feature to search for items in your current world only.
    • Added an icon that displays your character's current world.
    • Added a section that displays how many Maple Points you own.
    • Added an exclusive icon that displays for items sold from other worlds.
    • All items or mesos that need to be claimed before the maintenance on June 11, 2025, can be claimed by clicking the ‘Claim Existing Auction Items’ button in the Complete tab of the Auction House UI by July 11, 2026 at 11:59 PM UTC.
      • This includes items traded before February 28, 2018 that don’t have a claim period.
    • The ‘Claim Existing Auction Items’ button will be removed, and any unclaimed items will be deleted on July 12, 2026 at 12:00 AM UTC.

    Back to Top

    Cross World Meso Market

    The Cross World Meso Market is now available, allowing players to trade mesos across worlds!

    • The Cross World Meso Market is divided into one regional group, where you can trade mesos across all worlds within that region.
      • NA Region:
        • Group 1: Scania, Bera, Aurora, Elysium, Challenger
      • EU Region:
        • Group 1: Luna, Challenger

    • The Cross World Meso Market will be available once all completed trade costs and deposits from before the maintenance on June 11, 2025 are claimed.
      • To claim, click the ‘Quick Move’ button in a Town map and talk to Miss Richfield.
    • You can request and complete only one trade at a time.
    • During an active trade, trade requests, cancellations, and claiming mesos or Maple Points can only be done in the world where the trade was initiated.
    • You can view ongoing and completed trade history from any world.
    • You can request up to 100 trades a day per account.

    Meso Market Improvement and Changes

    • Added a feature displaying the recent trade data for the average trade costs of 100 billion mesos.
      • The average trade cost automatically updates over time.
    • Added a feature displaying the buyout cost, showing the amount needed to settle in increments of 100 million, 1 billion, or 10 billion mesos.
      • The buyout cost automatically updates over time.
    • Added a feature where you can check the status of ongoing trades and view trade history at any time.
    • Added a ‘Mesos & Maple Points’ button to show details in the chat window when claiming mesos and Maple Points.
    • Added a Revision feature where if a trade is still in progress and not completed, you can cancel it, change the requested price, and re-submit the trade with your new price.
    • Changed so that the completed trade costs can be claimed even if the trade was in progress when completed.
    • Increased the max trade request amount to 100 billion mesos.
    • Increased the maximum number of players waiting to buy or sell from 1,000 to 10,000.

    Back to Top

    Genesis Weapon Awakening Changes

    • Changed the mission completion requirements for Genesis Weapon Awakening to defeating the Commanders’ afterimages and collecting a certain amount of Trace of Darkness.
    • Removed the ‘[Genesis] After the Destined Battle’ quest requirement of destroying the Genesis Crux.
    • The amount of Trace of Darkness needed for each Commanders’ afterimage quest depends on the difficulty.
      • 1,500 Traces of Darkness can be accumulated.
      • Excess Trace of Darkness beyond the required amount for the current Commanders’ afterimage quest will carry over to the next quest.
    • The amount of Trace of Darkness required for each Commanders’ afterimage quest are:
    Commanders’ Afterimage Quest Required Trace of Darkness
    Traces of Von Leon: The Lion King 500
    Traces of Arkarium: The Guardian of Time 500
    Traces of Magnus: The Tyrant 500
    Traces of Lotus: The Wing Master 1,000
    Traces of Damien: The Sword of Destruction 1,000
    Traces of Will: The King of Spiders 1,000
    Traces of Lucid: Keeper of Nightmares 1,000
    Traces of Verus Hilla: The Red Witch 1,000
    • Players who already destroyed the Genesis Crux before the update will automatically receive 100% of the Trace of Darkness needed to complete that Commanders’ afterimage quest.
    • Trace of Darkness can also be extracted from the following bosses:
    Boss Trace of Darkness Extracted Amount
    Lotus (Normal) 10
    Damien (Normal) 10
    Easy Lucid (Easy) 15
    Easy Will (Easy) 15
    Lucid (Normal) 20
    Gloom (Normal) 20
    Will (Normal) 25
    Darknell (Normal) 25
    Versus Hilla (Normal) 45
    Lotus (Hard, Extreme) 50
    Damien (Hard) 50
    Lucid (Hard) 65
    Gloom (Chaos) 65
    Will (Hard) 75
    Darknell (Hard) 75
    Verus Hilla (Hard) 90
    Black Mage (Hard, Extreme) 600
    • When defeating a boss with a party, the total amount of Trace of Darkness extracted will be divided based on the number of players who entered.

    Back to Top

    Monster Park Improvements

    • Monster Park
      • Changed the ‘[Monster Park] Daily Medal Challenge’ quest completion requirements from 77 clears per day to either 30 daily clears or 3 Monster Park Extreme.
        • Characters currently working on the ‘[Monster Park] Daily Medal Challenge’ quest will have their progress maintained and will count towards the new quest completion requirements.
        • Updated the description of the ‘Seven Day Monster Parker’ medal to reflect the new quest completion requirements.
    • Monster Park Extreme
      • Monster Park Extreme entry will be closed until June 12 at 12:00 AM UTC for redecoration.
      • Changed the content type from Daily to Weekly.
        • Increased the EXP reward when cleared to 400%.
        • The clear record resets every Thursday at 12:00 AM UTC.
      • Increased the number of characters per world who can complete Monster Park Extreme each week to 2.
        • Characters who complete Monster Park Extreme for the week will be displayed in the Monster Park Extreme Entry UI.

      • Monster Park Extreme is now excluded from the Sunny Sunday Monster Park EXP bonus perk.
      • Moved the achievement ‘[Monster Park Extreme] From Enemies to Friends’ to the Memory tab and will no longer be available to complete.

    Back to Top

    Epic Dungeon Changes

    • Common
      • Epic Dungeon Entry will be closed until June 12 at 12:00 AM UTC for redecoration.
      • Increased the number of times an Epic Dungeon can be cleared per week per account to 2.
        • Only one type of Epic Dungeon can be cleared per character each week.
        • When entering an Epic Dungeon with your current account, you will only be able to enter Epic Dungeons on that account for the week.
        • When the progress for an Epic Dungeon is reset, the account and world that you can enter on for that week will not reset.
    • Epic Dungeon: High Mountain Stage Changes
      • All Stages
        • Decreased the amount of authority consumed for Sun Surge from 50 to 30.
        • Decreased the amount of authority consumed for Prominence from 150 to 100.
        • Decreased the amount of authority consumed for Solar Flare from 200 to 150.
      • Stages 4 and 5
        • Changed the points required to clear the stage from 3,700 to 2,600.
        • Changed some map structures for Stage 4.
      • Stages 7 and 8
        • Changed the points required to clear the stage from 4,500 to 3,500.
      • Stage 10
        • Increased the damage dealt to Tynos during the Massacre Phase from 20% to 30% of total HP.
    [Dev Team Comment]
    "We’ve identified the cause of the lag occurring in High Mountain and made improvements.
    First, we optimized the art asset of the Golden Bee monster appearing during the last wave of Stage 4, 5 which caused the most lag, and decreased the number of monsters summoned by half. But to make sure there are no changes to the gameplay, the points upon defeating the Golden Bee monster has been increased by 2 times. Additionally, we improved the stuttering issue by preloading the data of monsters that are summoned by a large amount in each wave.
    We will continue to strive to provide a pleasant environment for gameplay."

    Back to Top

    Sol Erda Conversion

    • Access the Sol Erda Conversion feature by clicking the ‘Erda Conversion’ button in the HEXA Matrix or Erda Link UI.

    • Convert your owned Sol Erda into Faint Sol Erda Energy or HEXA Boosters.
    Sol Erda Converted Item Created Quantity
    1 Faint Sol Erda Energy: Tradable within world, expires the day after conversion at 12:00 AM UTC. 30
    HEXA Booster: Tradable within world, expires the day after conversion at 12:00 AM UTC. 1

    • Use a HEXA Booster to summon monsters that give a large amount of EXP when defeated within 100 seconds.
      • Can only be used by characters who have completed the 6th Job Advancement.
      • Must be used in a map where monsters are within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above).

    Back to Top

    Auto-Harvest Profession System Improvements

    • Added a hotkey that can be assigned to open the Auto-Harvest UI.
    • Added a notification feature that can be toggled in the Auto-Harvest UI. Notifications will pop up for the following statuses:
      • When Auto-Harvest is complete.
      • When you log in again while Auto-Harvest is in progress, it shows the remaining time.
      • When the daily Auto-Harvest reset occurs.
      • If Auto-Harvest is available but not yet started.

    • Added Plantyroid to the Profession Credit Shop.
      • Upon equipping Plantyroid, double-click it to open the Auto-Harvest UI.

    • Changed the daily Auto-Harvest limit from 8 hours to 4 hours.
    • Changed so that if a character with an Auto-Harvest in progress exits the game or switches characters, it will automatically resume when that same character logs back in.
      • The Auto-Harvest time does not accumulate when you exit the game or are in the character selection screen.
    • Increased the amount of Profession Credit obtainable per day from 150 Coins to 300 Coins.
    • Increased the amount of Profession Credit obtainable per week from 1,050 Coins to 2,100 Coins.
    • Increased the quantity limits in the Profession Credit Shop for the following items:
    Item Price Old Quantity Limit New Quantity Limit
    Mysterious Mineral Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. 50 20 No Change
    Mineral Selector Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. (Select a mineral of your choice and receive x10) 100 5 10
    Mysterious Herb Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. 50 20 No Change
    Herb Selector Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. (Select an herb of your choice and receive x10) 100 5 10
    Magic Powder Selector Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. (Select a magic powder of your choice and receive x10) 150 5 10
    Mysterious Magic Powder Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. 75 20 No Change
    Mysterious Essence Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. 100 10 20
    Essence Selector Pouch: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. (Select and obtain either Dusk Essence or Brilliant Dusk Essence) 200 3 10
    Plantyroid Coupon: Tradable within world, 7-day duration.

    Use to receive the following:

    • Plantyroid:
      • Heroic Worlds: Untradable, Permanent.
      • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within world, Permanent.
    		 1,000 N/A Unlimited

    Back to Top

    Link Skill Revamp

    • The daily limit for transferring link skills has been removed.
    • The meso fee required to transfer a link skill more than 5 times has been removed.
    • Changed where transferring, removing, and accessing presets for link skills cannot be used in Boss Battle maps.

    • To access the Link Skill UI, open the Skill UI and double-click on the Link Manager skill in the Beginner tab.
    • Your owned link skills are displayed at the bottom of the Link Skill UI.
    • Click the ‘+’ button on a Link Skill to activate and assign it to a preset.
      • You can set up to three different presets for your link skills.
    • When a link skill is assigned, it will now automatically apply to all characters within the same world who have completed the ‘Teaching Link Skill’ quest.
    • Select the ‘View Link Skills You Don't Own’ checkbox to view all Link Skills you can obtain. Hover over the skills to see detailed information like which job it belongs to and the bonus effects it provides.

    Back to Top

    Quest Improvements and Changes

    Story Quest

    • Changed so that Arcane River and Grandis region Story Quests can now be skipped by characters within the account (instead of within the world).
      • When one character has completed the Arcane River and Grandis region Story Quests, all characters within the same account will have the option to either view the summarized story or immediately skip it without having to complete the prerequisite quests.
      • Viewing the summarized story or skipping the Story Quests will automatically complete all quests associated with it. Item rewards except for EXP will be given.

    • Changed so that prerequisite quests to unlock a Boss can now be skipped by characters within the account (instead of within the world).
      • When one character has completed the prerequisite quests to unlock a Boss, all characters within the same account will have access to the boss content without having to complete the prerequisite quests.
    • Changed so that [Root Abyss] quests can now be skipped by characters within the account (instead of within the world).
      • When one character has completed the ‘[Root Abyss] World Tree Rescue’ quest, all characters within the same account will have the option to skip it in the ‘[Root Abyss] An Urgent Summons’ quest.
      • If characters have completed the ‘[Root Abyss] An Urgent Summons’ quest and the story quest is in-progress, it cannot be skipped.
      • Skipping the quest will automatically complete all quests associated with it. Item rewards except for EXP will be given.

    Symbol Quest

    Grandis

    • Changed the Grandis daily quests completion conditions of defeating monsters to gradually decrease from 500, 300, 100 for that region. The amount is determined by the highest region unlocked.
    • If a Grandis daily quest is in-progress from Wednesday 12:00 AM UTC before the patch until maintenance ends, your progress records will be reset.
    • If a Grandis daily quest is completed from Wednesday 12:00 AM UTC before the patch until maintenance ends, your progress records will be saved.

    Arcane River

    • Changed the Arcane River daily quests completion conditions of defeating monsters to gradually decrease from 500, 300, 100 for that region. The amount is determined by the highest region unlocked.
    • The amount of Arcane Symbols given for clearing the Arcane River special content once has been increased from 15 to 40.

    Symbol Express Pass Discount

    • The Grandis' daily quest instant completion fee is now 1,000, 600, or 200 Maple Points depending on the highest region unlocked.
    • The Arcane River daily quest instant completion fee is now 1,000, 600, or 200 Maple Points depending on the highest region unlocked.

    Arcane River Quest

    Grand Athenaeum: Maple Chronicle

    • The ‘Book of Arcane River' will be temporarily unavailable after the June 11, 2025 maintenance and will return in a future update.

    Vanishing Journey

    • In-progress quests have been reset.
    • Dialogue and cutscenes for some quests have been updated.
    • Added Vanishing Journey related dialogue and cutscenes to the ‘A Greater Power’ quest.
