    Common Quest

    • Lion King’s Castle Quest
      • Added quest to Lion King’s Castle
        • [Lion King's Castle] Finally, Forever
      • Changed the NPC of some Lion King’s Castle quests.
        • Perform the King's Dignity quest through the broken slate.
        • Perform Ifia's Treasure quest through Cecilia.
      • Resolved an issue where players were not able to carry out the quest in [Lion King's Castle] Defeat the Lion King' under certain conditions.
    • Fixing Eos Tower Quest
      • Changed starting requirements for ‘Fixing Eos Tower’ quests.
      • Removed ‘Fixing Eos Tower’ quest from the ‘Ludibrium’s Best Worker is Yours Truly!’ quest achievement.
    • Profession Quest
      • Changed the ‘[Profession] The Professional]’ quest level requirement to Lv. 100.
      • Resolved an issue where the dialogue did not fit the current specs of profession related quests.
        • [Profession] The Professional
        • [Profession] Saffron's Herbalism Lecture
        • [Profession] Cole's Mining Lecture
    • Added guide text to the tab content when the ‘[Black Mage] Destiny Define’ quest is in progress.
    • Changed entry requirement to Lv. 50 in Dead Mine Cave Investigation.
    • Resolved an issue Demon Slayer characters appeared in incorrect locations during the Black Heaven storyline.
    • Resolved an issue where the NPC image would cover the Arcana Daily Quest content.
    • Resolved an issue where certain Medal quests were categorized incorrectly.
    • Resolved an issue where the background music in [Shangri-La] Collapsing Shangri-La 2 would not play.
    • Resolved an issue where players were not able to start the ‘[Esfera] In Search of Tana’ quest again when forfeited.
    • Resolved an issue when the ‘[Genesis Weapon] Trailing the Traces of the Black Mage' quest was in progress, the Black Mage’s Binding debuff did not disappear when leaving a party midbattle against Von Leon.
    • Resolved an issue where the 2nd round bonus effect guide appeared awkward when the FriendStory episode reset.
    • Resolved an issue where the map guide appeared awkward in ‘[Cernium (After)] Library in Flames’.
    • Resolved an issue where Mirror-touched Sea 3 and 4 appeared during the Quest UI’s Navigation function for '[Morass] Rage of the King'.
    • Resolved an issue where some quests were not visible in the Quest UI because it was not included in the correct category:
      • [Ghost Park] Normal Mode Challenge
      • [Ghost Park] Normal Mode Super Challenge
      • [Ghost Park] Normal Mode Survival Challenge
    • Resolved an issue where the achievement count did not count when completing the following Tallahart Daily Quests:
      • ‘[Daily Quest] What a Lovely Day for a Quest’
      • ‘[Daily Quest] What a Gloomy Day… It’d be Better with a Daily Quest!’
      • ‘[Daily Quest] What Boring Day. Let’s do a Quest!’

    Back to Top

    UI Improvements and Changes

    Legion Placement UI

    • Improved Legion Member Placement Mode UI
      • Added a filler feature that categorizes the Legion Member list by job.

    • Added Legion Member Automatic Placement Feature
      • Use the Legion Member Automatic Placement feature by clicking the Automatic Placement button in the Legion Member Placement Mode UI.
      • When you use Automatic Placement, it will search for a suitable position after you select the member and the placement area.
      • If you successfully find the placement result that matches the selected setting, you can instantly apply the result to the Legion Member Placement Mode.

    Medal/Title Appearance UI

    You can now customize how your Medal or Title appears on your character!

    • Access the UI by opening your character's Equipment Inventory UI, then click the ‘Medals/Titles’ button.
    • Both the Medal and Title sections have an Equip slot and an Appearance slot.
      • Only one Medal and one Title can be displayed at a time, regardless of equipment presets.

    Equip Slot

    • When a Medal/Title is registered in the Equip slot, both the effects and appearance will be applied to your character.
    • When an item is equipped here, its icon will appear grayed out in the Appearance slot.

    Appearance Slot

    • When a Medal/Title is registered in the Appearance slot, only the image and text of the items are applied.
      • You can toggle whether you want to display the appearance of the Medal/Title by clicking the ‘Display Medal/Title’ box.
      • If a Medal with a Fusion Anvil applied is registered in the Appearance slot, the fused item’s appearance will be displayed.
    • If there isn’t anything registered in the Equip slot, the appearance cannot be displayed. Regardless if an item is registered in the Appearance slot.

    Medal UI

    A brand new Medal UI is here! Redesigned to be easier to navigate with improved features that help you view, sort, and celebrate the Medals you’ve earned throughout your MapleStory journey.

    • Access the Medal UI by clicking the ‘Menu’ icon then ‘Medal’ near your quickslots or by pressing the ‘Medal’ hotkey.
    • The Medal UI has two main tabs: Medal Collection and Medal Quest.

    Medal Collection

    • In the Medal Collection tab you can view and sort all your registered Medals in one place.
    • Medals can also be sorted by the following options:
      • Newest First
      • Oldest First
      • A - Z
      • Z - A
    • Current equipped Medals will display an equipped icon in the list.

    Medal Quest

    • In the Medal Quest tab, you can view your in-progress and see available Medal-related quests.
      • Categories within this tab can be filtered to focus on what you’d like to do!

    Additional Features

    • Hovering over any Medal will show a full preview with details.
    • A search feature is available to quickly find specific Medals or Medal related quests.

    Quest UI

    All quest-related UIs have been reorganized making it easier to track your progress and manage!

    • Access the Quest UI by clicking the ‘Menu’ icon then ‘Quest Log’ near your quickslots or by pressing the ‘Quest’ hotkey.
    • Quests are now categorized by type and each type has its own dedicated tab in the Quest UI:
      • Story: Main quests, Job advancements, Events, and general story content
      • Repeat: Daily and Weekly quests
      • Guide: Helpful progression content
      • Cash: Quests related to Cash items, Maple Rewards, and time-limited events
    • Each tab has an area with a feature tailored to its quest type, to help manage and complete quests more easily.
      • Story: Quests can be filtered by Required, Job Advancement, Skill, Region, Boss, Content, System
      • Repeat: A button that opens the Maple Planner
      • Guide: A button that links to our Official Guides on the website
      • Cash: A button that opens the Cash Shop

    • Quests in each tab are sorted into three sections:
      • In-Progress
        • The listed quests are sorted based on the following:
          • Quests that can be completed
          • Recommended quests
          • Frequently accessed categories
          • Quests within your level range
      • Available
      • Completed

    • Quests that are not within your level range are displayed in a lighter color.
    • Clicking the text of an NPC’s name, enemy, or map name in the Quest Info UI to automatically highlight their locations on the world map.
    • Event Participation quests have been removed from the UI.

    Quest Notifier

    • Increased the amount of quests that can be added to the quest notifier from 5 to 20.
      • If the quest helper is full, the quest at the bottom will be removed automatically.
    • Completed or newly added quotes will move to the top of the list.
    • New quests are added to the notifier automatically if there’s space.

    NPC Quests

    • Quest names in NPC dialogue will display a category icon next to the name.

    Lightbulb UI

    • Quests in the in the lightbulb UI will follow the same sorting as the Quest UI:
      • Recommended quests
      • Frequently accessed categories
      • Quests within your level range

    Key Binding UI

    • Added custom key binding features to allow easier settings for basic key bindings and quickslots.
      • Saved key binds are by account and are applied upon character creation and key binding reset.
      • Note that some jobs do not allow key binding within the tutorial map or when characters are newly created. Key binds can be made within the Key Binding UI menu once the tutorial ends.
    • Added import preset feature.
      • You can import and copy the key bind information of another preset.
    • Adjusted so when you hover your cursor over the buttons in the key bindings UI, the tooltip of that feature is output

    Emoticon UI

    • Added emoticon image output to chat window upon using emoticon input rules.
      • Displays emoticons in the chat box or Maple Chat when adding “ : “ to both sides of the emoticon name.
      • Displays a preview of an emoticon with the relevant text in the auto-completion list above the chat when adding” : “ and certain texts in the chat box.

    • This feature only applies for emoticons you own.
    • You cannot use emoticons in Megaphone items.
    • Added Favorites feature to allow registering emoticons to Favorites
      • Click the Favorites button of the emoticon slot (located at the upper right of each emoticon) to add to Favorites.
    • Added Key Bindings UI Connection button to Emoticon UI.
    • Added the following basic emoticons:
    Name Emoticon
    Orange Mushroom
    Pepe
    Pink Bean
    Yeti
    Rock Spirit
    Roo-bot
    Chu Chu
    Island Tomboy
    Desert Rabbit
    Boss Battle

    Chat Window UI

    • The internal/external Chat Window UI has been updated and positions of some buttons have been adjusted.

    • Added Chat Window setting UI
      • When clicking the Chat Window settings button, a new UI will display for chat fonts and other various chat settings.
      • You can now set the fonts and colors of the text in default conversation and party chats.
      • There are a total of 24 different font colors.
      • Settings related to the chat window can no longer be changed within the Options UI.
    • The Battle tab for the internal and external chat window has been renamed to the Etc tab.

    Common UI

    • Updated the information text displayed when attempting to access Special Content from a map that isn't in the Maple Guide UI.
    • Resolved an issue where the Hyper Burning designation button would appear in the character selection screen when it’s not a Hyper Burning event.
    • Resolved an issue where cash items couldn’t be equipped in the Cash Shop Preview.
    • Changed so you can view your current Maple Points in the Epic Dungeon Rewards and Bonus Rewards UI.
      • Hovering over the “Select Bonus Reward’ button will display how many Maple Points are required.
    • Improved the previews for Auction House and Cash Shop:
      • Added previews for attack motions with the current equipped weapon.
        • The attack motion will not play if a weapon is not equipped or a special action is active.
      • Cash weapon effects are visible in the preview, even if the weapon type doesn’t match your equipped weapon.
      • Changed where basic attack animations now reflect the correct weapon type when Guns, Claws, Dual Blowguns, Hand Cannons, Soul Shooters, or Whispershots are equipped.
    • Added a blacklist icon to display next to the name of a character or guild that you’ve added to your blacklist.
    • Changed the Change Character Name UI.
    • Changed the design of several system confirmation windows.
    • Changed the button designs in Evan and Zero’s skill books.
    • Resolved an issue where the cooldown end notification appeared in the wrong locations.
    • Increased the amount of cooldown end notifications displayed up to 3 at a time.
    • Improved where double-clicking on a monster's image in the Monster Collection will automatically highlight its location in the world map.
    • Changed where existing Sharenian Culvert through the portal or NPC Daedal in ‘Path from the Altar’ a message will now pop up confirming if you want to exit or stay.
    • Resolved an issue where some hotkey functions were awkward when the Guild UI was open.
    • Resolved an issue where tooltips would appear upon hovering over the bottom area, even when the Tallahart region wasn’t exposed in the Symbol Express Pass UI.
    • Resolved an issue where the Raid Power of a non-logged-in character was displayed as a negative number after Raid Power was added in the character selection window.
    • Resolved an issue where players sometimes couldn’t enter Maple Chronicle in Grand Athenaeum even when not doing anything else.
    • Resolved an issue where the completion window did not close after Profession’s Production was finished.
    • Resolved an issue where descriptions did not display when hovering over V Matrix and HEXA Matrix in Evan and Zero Skill Books.
    • Resolved an issue where the 10-minute guild mark change cooldown was not applied immediately after upload.
    • Resolved an issue where the 'Back to Original' and 'Save' buttons did not activate after resetting hotkeys in the Hotkey Setting UI.

    Back to Top

    Map/Movement Improvements and Changes

    Town Portal

    • A new Town Portal has been added to all Major Towns!

    • To use the Town Portal, click Town Portal or press the up arrow key near the portal to open the Town Portal UI.

    • You can teleport to any of the three continents: Maple World, Grandis, and Arcane River. Once a continent is selected, you can choose your destination town.

    Hyper Teleport Rock Changes

    • The Hyper Teleport Rock functionality is now considered a core feature of the game’s movement system and will be integrated into the new World Map UI.
    • The Hyper Teleport Rock is usable in maps without teleport restrictions.
    • Each use has a 5-minute cooldown and applies only to the character that used it.
    • The purchase and sale of Teleport Rocks, Hyper Teleport Rocks, and VIP Teleport Rocks from the Cash Shop will end after the maintenance on June 11, 2025.
      • Players who already own Teleport Rocks before the maintenance on June 11, 2025 can continue using them until they expire, along with the ‘chase character’ feature. Note: This means permanent Teleport Rocks can still be used forever.

    Premium Hyper Teleport Rock

    • The Premium Hyper Teleport Rock instantly removes the cooldown for that teleport when activated.
    • The effect applies immediately upon purchase and lasts for the selected duration from the time of purchase.
      • Buying additional Premium Hyper Teleport Rocks will extend the remaining duration by the amount purchased.
    • Premium Hyper Teleport Rock can be obtained by purchasing through the World Map UI or with Premium Hyper Teleport Rock Coupon.
    Premium Hyper Teleport Rock Prices
    Duration Interactive World Price
    (Maple Points)    		 Heroic World Price
    (Meso)
    1 Day 500 5,200,000
    7 Days 2,500 25,000,000
    31 Days 7,800 100,000,000

    World Map Revamp

    • A new Map Info section has been added to the World Map UI. When you select a map, this panel displays detailed information including:
      • Type of Map: Town, Instanced Map, Regular Map
      • Minimum entry level and entry quest requirements
      • Star Force, Arcane Power, Sacred Power requirements
      • NPC and enemy details.

    • You can now view the map your character is currently on, as well as up to four higher-level maps depending on your current location, helping you plan your next move more easily!
    • A filter feature has been added to the search UI where you can narrow down your search by category:
      • Enemy (The level range can be set)
      • NPC
      • Map
    • Map information in the world map UI now display text in different colors to indicate what category it belongs to:
      • Enemies - Red
      • NPC - Blue
      • Maps - Green
    • You can now change the order of your Favorite maps! In the Favorite section, right click on a map name and select the ‘Change Location’ button to rearrange how they appear.

    • A Hyper Teleport Rock button has been added to the World Map UI. Double-click on a map or click the ‘Hyper Teleport Rock’ button, then press ‘Go Now’ after selecting your destination.

    • The teleport can also be triggered by clicking the ‘Go Now’ button in the navigation UI.
    • The Hyper Teleport Rock has a 5-minute cooldown and the timer is displayed directly in the UI.
      • The cooldown for any World Teleport Map items you already own is not reflected here.
    • A Premium Hyper Teleport Rock button has been added onto the World Map UI. The button changes color when a Premium Hyper Teleport Rock is active.

    • Removed the Smart Mount feature and can no longer be used.
    • Removed the following Smart Mount quests:
      • [Smart Mount] That Thing for Manji
      • [Smart Mount] Wing's Homework
      • [Smart Mount] Mrs. Ming Ming's Lunchbox
      • [Smart Mount] Lend a Hand
      • [Smart Mount] Irvin and Social Responsibility
      • [Auto-Pilot Mount] Irvin's Customer Care Center
      • [Smart Mount] Success with Irvin
      • [Smart Mount] Irvin's Gift

    Mini-Map Revamp

    The mini-map UI has been revamped with new features making navigating to any destination absolutely lightwork.

    • A Move to Town feature has been added.
      • Hover the mouse over the Move to Town button and the name of the nearest town will appear. Clicking the button will instantly move you to the town.
        • The feature cannot be used in areas with Teleport restrictions.

    • A button to open the Navigation UI has been added.
    • The NPC list of the map you’re in can now be sorted by feature, name, and location.
    • A filter feature has been added where you can choose what NPC and character to appear on your mini-map. The following categories can be filtered:
      • NPC: Normal, Shop, Storage Keeper, Special/Event, Teleport.
      • Character: My Character, Party, Friend/Spouse, Guild/Alliance.

    • Some icons on the mini-map have been changed.
    • The Return Scroll - Nearest Town item will be removed from all General Stores
    • The ‘Return Scroll - Nearest Town Tutorial’ will be removed.

    Common Map

    • Changed so players are teleported to the original map when entering Karote Summit via the Boss UI or Maple Planner.
    • Resolved an issue where a red dot sometimes appeared at the Minar Forest: Crossroad to the Canyon map.
    • Resolved an issue allowing ability resets in event maps.
    • Resolved an issue where portals did not work under certain conditions in Odium: The Wellspring.

    Back to Top

    Boss/Mob Improvements and Changes

    Boss Reward Party Distribution System

    Blink for loot parties just got safer! With the new Boss Reward Party Distribution System, drops are automatically distributed to all party members, so no more loot swiping!

    • To change the Pick-Up Rights, click the ‘Settings’ button in the Party UI and select ‘Distribution’
    • When the pick-up rights are set to Distribution, rewards are divided equally among all party members via the Boss Reward UI that appears after defeating a boss.
      • All party members will receive the Power Rebirth Crystal, while other items are distributed randomly.
      • If a player leaves the party or map during the distribution setup, they will not be considered part of the reward distribution.
      • Solo parties will always have Pick-Up Rights set to ‘All’, regardless if Distribution is the selected setting.

    • For higher value items, when Distribution is enabled, each party member will receive a random number between 1 and 999 after the boss is defeated for a special distribution. The player with the highest number wins the reward.
      • If not all party members participate in the distribution, it will still proceed as if everyone is involved.
    • Rewards obtained through the Distribution system can be claimed in the Boss Rewards tab of the Storage Room UI.
    • Special distribution will occur for the following items:
    Boss Item
    Lotus (Hard, Extreme) Damaged Black Heart
    Lotus (Hard, Extreme) Berserked
    Lotus (Extreme) Total Control
    Damien (Hard) Magic Eyepatch
    Lucid (Hard) Dreamy Belt
    Will (Hard) Cursed Spellbook Coupon
    Gloom (Chaos) Endless Terror
    Guard Captain Darknell (Hard) Commanding Force Earring
    Verus Hilla (Hard) Source of Suffering
    Black Mage (Hard, Extreme) Genesis Badge
    Chosen Seren (Hard, Extreme) Mitra's Rage Selection Box
    Black Mage (Extreme) Exceptional Hammer (Belt)
    Chosen Seren (Extreme) Exceptional Hammer (Face Acc)
    Kalos the Guardian (Extreme) Exceptional Hammer (Eye Acc)
    Kaling (Extreme) Exceptional Hammer (Earrings)
    Limbo (Hard) Whisper of the Source
    Lotus (Extreme) White Jade Boss Ring Box
    Black Mage (Hard, Extreme)
    Chosen Seren (Hard, Extreme)
    Kalos the Guardian (Easy, Normal)
    Kaling (Easy, Normal)
    Kalos the Guardian (Normal, Chaos) Grindstone of Life
    Kaling (Normal, Hard)
    Kalos the Guardian (Chaos, Extreme) Divine Eternal Armor Box
    Kaling (Hard, Extreme) Ferocious Beast Eternal Armor Box
    Limbo (Hard) Eternal Armor of Desire Box

    Common Boss and Mob

    • Kaling
      • The position of the Interact/Harvest skill UI is now saved.
    • Limbo (Normal, Hard)
      • Resolved an issue where Shadow of the Source sometimes did not move in phase 2’s Beyond the Bounds of Truth.
      • Resolved an issue where Abnormal Status effects were not applied when hit by Snatching Grasp or Mastermind Glutton in phase 3.
    • Papulatus (Normal)
      • Resolved an issue where HP couldn’t be recovered by absorbing Otherworld Papulatus phase 2.
    • Resolved an issue with text spacings when an Elite Monster or Boss had a modifier.
    • Resolved an issue where mobs that do not move horizontally could have their movement reset based on the character’s location.

    Back to Top

    NPC Improvements and Changes

    • Resolved an issue where NPC Oz’s image displayed incorrectly in the Black Heaven story.

    Back to Top

    Item Improvements and Changes

    • Daily Gift Reward Changes
      • Starting July 1, 2025 at 12:00 AM UTC, the Hyper Teleport Rock from the Daily Gift will be replaced with a Premium Hyper Teleport Rock Coupon (1-day): Tradable within world, 7-day duration.
    • Angelic Buster Compact Item
      • Updated the Compact item tooltip to explain that the compact dress will not appear when a cash outfit, top, bottom, and shoes are equipped.
      • Improved where the Compact can be equipped on its own without also equipping the exclusive dress when removing other outfits (outfit, top, bottom, shoes).
        • When the Compact is equipped while still wearing a full outfit set, the exclusive dress appearance will not be shown.
        • To confirm that the Compact is equipped, open the Cash tab in the character’s Inventory UI and see if the Compact has an equipped mark (E) on it.
    • VIP Boosters
      • Changed what completion counts Flame Monsters summoned using a VIP Booster will now count towards:
        • MAPLE Daily Gift
        • Harvesting/Mining requirements
        • Legion Artifact Weekly Missions
        • Guild Weekly Hunting Points
        • Achievement: Enemies Near your Level Defeat Count
    • Potential Stamps
      • Changed where Potential Stamp items can now be used on Genesis Lazuli and Genesis Lapis if they have 2 lines of Potential or Bonus Potential
    • Added the Maplemas version of Cernium BGM to the playlist for the Yeti Snowball Fight Chair and Pink Bean Snowball Fight Chair.
    • Updated the Pet Equipment Pure Clean Slate Scroll 100% item description.
    • Updated the spacing for pet equipment names.
    • Resolved an issue where the icon was positioned incorrectly for the Apprentice Witch Hallowkitty Emoticon.
    • Resolved an issue where players appeared on ladders or ropes with their androids.
    • Resolved an issue where the tradability information text was displayed in the description for items with the Mark of Binding.
    • Resolved an issue where the back images looked awkward when Brown and White Hare Expedition Backpacks were equipped.
    • Resolved an issue where the Maple Style Magazine, Exciting Home Party, and Dream Debut Performance Chair sometimes displayed incorrectly.
    • Resolved an issue where item skills appeared incorrectly in the Skill UI after unequipping.
    • Resolved an issue where cash items with a skill, when equipped using the Outfit Preset, could not be used.
    • Resolved an issue where Beta characters couldn’t use skills on cash items with a skill.
    • Resolved an issue where Luminous could relearn all 1st Job Light and Darkness skills using the Special SP Reset Scroll.
    • Resolved an issue where the effects of some Effect Rings were visible on non-humanoid androids.
    • Resolved an issue where the Kanao Hair shadow appeared awkward.
    • Resolved an issue where Maha the Polearm sometimes displayed strangely.
    • Resolved an issue where Green, Purple, and Blue Drag Pets had awkward chat bubble images.
    • Resolved an issue where the pet label image for Green Drag looked awkward.
    • Resolved an issue where Jade Silk Outfit (M) and Jade Silk Outfit (F) sometimes appeared awkward.
    • Resolved an issue where pets with the auto-potion skill learned had limited potion use when attacked by enemies.

    Back to Top

    Smart AI Correction

    • A new graphics setting has been added to make the game look smoother, making character movement, skill effects and enemy actions feel faster.
    • Smart AI Correction can be enabled in the Options UI under the ‘Graphics’ tab.
      • We recommend enabling V-Sync when using this feature.

    • Please note that some text in labels, Medals, and Titles may appear distorted if you move too quickly.
    • If the feature causes screen glitches or performance issues, it’s recommended to have this feature disabled.

    Back to Top

    DirectX 11

    MapleStory now officially supports DirectX 11!

    DirectX 11 will be supported after the v.260 update on June 11, 2025 to provide a more enjoyable gaming experience. We ask that you update to DirectX 11.0 or higher to ensure your game runs smoothly as support for DirectX 9 will end from that point onwards.

    Troubleshooting

    If the game doesn’t launch or you see a DirectX-related error after the update, we recommend checking your system’s DirectX version and updating if needed.

    • To download and update DirectX to the latest version, click HERE.

    Back to Top

    Morning Star Banquet Events

    Morning Star Banquet

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who completed ‘Gob’s Call’ quest or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    Are y’all HUNGRY? Our Morning Star Feast has begun and it's time to pig out! Join us on our daily feast and claim some delicious rewards~

    How to Participate

    • Select ‘Morning Star Feast’ from the Event List UI and click ‘Participate’ to begin.
      • Alternatively, you can talk to the Head Servant NPC located in the Event Map, Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens, and complete the ‘[Morning Star] Perfect Feast Prep’ quest.
    • Keep up with your progress by clicking ‘Morning Star Feast’ from the Event List.
    • All characters within your account share your progress!

    Morning Star Feast

    • Daily Feast Prep
      • You can complete your Daily Feast Prep by clicking ‘Daily Feast Prep’ from the Event UI from the respective day. Upon checking in your Daily Feast Prep, you will receive the following:
        • 3x EXP Coupon (30 min) (x3)
        • Morning Light skill points (x5)
        • Starlight skill points (x5)
      • The Daily Feast Prep can be completed 5 times a week per account. You can obtain set rewards based on your cumulative Daily Feast Prep count.
      • You can claim these rewards by clicking the ‘Claim’ button, then select between the Memento Coin and the Daily Feast Prep reward item.
        • Please keep in mind, you will not be able to change your claimed item after selecting!
      • The Memento Coin quantity will differ from each Daily Feast Prep depending on the reward item.
      • Daily Feast Prep can be done up to 50 times overall within the event period.
    • Special Feast Prep
      • Defeat 2,000 monsters within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above) to complete a check-in. Upon checking in your Special Feast Prep, you will receive the following:
        • Memento Coin x1,000
      • Memento Coins can be used to exchange for various items within the Memento Coin Exchange shop!
      • Each check-in can be completed up to 3 times a week per account and cleared 3 times at once. Special Feast Prep can be done up to 30 times overall within the event period.
      • Complete all of the Special Feast Prep and you can obtain Hyper Burninator x1
        • Burning perks will be available until November 11, 2025.
        • Hyper Burninator cannot be claimed in Challenger World.
    Special Feast Prep Check-in records reset every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC
    • Daily Feast Pass and Special Feast Pass
      • Missed a day of the Daily or Special Feast Prep? Use 3,000 Maple Points to purchase either the Daily Feast Prep or the Special Feast Prep check-in!
      • The total number of missed check-ins and Daily/Special Feast Passes available for purchase reset every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC each week.

    Daily Feast Prep Rewards

    • You can claim these items anytime within the event period.
    • You can choose to claim either the daily feast prep reward item or the memento coin.
    Daily Daily Feast Prep Reward Item Memento Coin
    Reward Quantity
    1 Prepared Pendant of the Spirit Coupon (30-day): Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC.

    Use to receive:

    • Prepared Pendant of the Spirit: Untradable, 30-day duration.

    Use to choose one of the following:

    • Arcane Symbol Selector Coupon (x300): Tradable within world, 7-day duration.
    • Sacred Symbol Selector Coupon (x60): Tradable within world, 7-day duration.

    13 Banquet Gem Damage Skin (Unit): Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC.

    		50
    14 Luxe Sauna Coupon: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC. 50
    15 Sol Erda: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC. 500
    16 Luxe Sauna Coupon: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC. 50

    Karma Black Rebirth Flame x20 (Heroic): Tradable within world, expires August 27 (start of maintenance).    		 500
    50 Spiegelette's Golden Tomato Punch King One-Time Entry Pass: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC. 500
      • Daily Feast Prep Completion Reward:
        • Transcendent Growth Potion: Tradable within world, 14-day duration.
      • Special Feast Prep Completion Reward:
        • Hyper Burninator: Tradable within world, 14-day duration.
          • Can be used by a character that is Lv. 10 to 258, who is not already a Hyper Burning MAX character.
          • The Hyper Burninator effect will be active from the date it is used until November 11, 2025 at 12:00 AM UTC.
          • The Zero class can only be used from characters Lv. 200 to Lv. 258 who have completed Story Quest Act 2.
          • If Hyper Burninator is used, the 1+4 Level Up Effect is applied and cannot be canceled once used.
          • When using Hyper Burninator on a character that with either a Tera Burning or Mega Burning effect, that character will lose the Tera Burning and Mega Burning effect.
          • The Hyper Burning Booster cannot be claimed in Challenger World once all 5 World Leaps have been used.

    Reward Notes

      • Luxe Sauna Coupon is activated and charged instantly upon use.
        • Only usable during the Luxe Sauna event period.
      • Magnificent Growth Potion and Transcendent Growth Potion can be used by Burning characters.
      • Advanced EXP Vouchers can be used by Lv. 260 and above characters or Zero characters that complete Story Quest Act 2.
        • Characters at Lv. 290 and above earn the same amount of EXP as they would have earned at Lv. 290.
      • Hair and Face change or equipping Cash Items are not possible for Breumiroid.
      • Backgrounds obtained from the Background coupon cannot be moved with you upon World Leap. However, it can be moved as a coupon 1 time, when leaping from Challenger World to another world.
    ⚠️ Daily Feast Prep Rewards can only be claimed from June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Back to Top

    Morning Starlight Harvest

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who participated in the ‘Morning Star Feast’ or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    Not totally full from the Daily Morning Star Feast rewards?? Let’s make room for some sweet event buffs with Morning Starlight Harvest!

    How to Participate

    • Select ‘Morning Star Harvest’ from the Event List UI and click ‘Participate’ to begin.
      • Alternatively, you can talk to Angelo located in Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens and complete the ‘[Morning Starlight Harvest] Angelo’s Request’ quest.
    • Keep up with your progress by clicking ‘Morning Star Harvest’ from the Event List.
    • When you complete the Daily Feast Prep from the ‘Morning Star Feast’ event, you will receive the following:
      • Morning Light skill points (x5)
      • Starlight skill points (x5)
    • Use the Morning Light and Starlight to activate the Morning Light Phantom skill effect.
    • The activated skill effects can be enhanced by using any owned Morning Light or Starlight and leveled up skill effects provides more powerful benefits.
    • The Morning Light Phantom skill is a passive buff skill that can be used until August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC.

    Event Buffs

    • Morning Light Phantom
    Type Lv. 1 Lv. 2 Lv. 3 Lv. 4 Lv. 5 Lv. 6
    Attack Power & Magic ATT 5 10 15 20 30 40
    Boss Damage 5% 10% 20% 25% 35% 40%
    Ignore Defense 5% 10% 20% 25% 35% 40%
    All Stats 10 20 30 40 60 80
    HP & MP 500 1000 1500 2000 3000 4000
    Buff Duration 5% 10% 15% 20% 25% 30%
    Critical Rate 5% 10% 15% 20% 25% 30%
    Normal Enemy Damage 5% 10% 20% 25% 35% 40%
    Arcane Power 10 20 30 40 50 60
    EXP Obtained 2.50% 5% 7.50% 10% 12.50% 15%
    Sacred Power 10 20 30 40 50 60
    • Starlight Phantom
    Type Lv. 1 Lv. 2 Lv. 3 Lv. 4 Lv. 5 Lv. 6
    Sol Erda obtained from bosses 10% 20% 40% 60% 80% 100%
    Monster Collection Capture Chance 10% 20% 40% 60% 80% 100%
    Bounty Hunter / Inferno Wolf Bonus EXP 10% 20% 40% 60% 80% 100%
    Monster Park Clear EXP 5% 10% 20% 30% 40% 50%
    Arcane River Daily Mission Reward 1 2 4 6 8 10
    Grandis Daily Mission Rewards 1 2 3 4 5 6
    Bonus Coins Upon Completing Legion Weekly Missions 100 150 200 250 300 400
    • Amount of Morning Light or Starlight needed to level up Morning or Starlight skills:
    Level Required Quantity
    1 1
    2 3
    3 8
    4 13
    5 20
    6 25

    How to Obtain Morning Light Phantom

      • Characters within the same world that complete the Morning Starlight Harvest quest will be granted the Morning Light Phantom skill.
      • The Morning Star Phantom skill can be viewed from the Beginner Skill window, with benefits only applied to characters that learned the skill.
      • Purchase count for both Morning Light and Starlight is reset every Thursday at 12:00 AM UTC.
      • You can purchase the amount you need with 1,000 Maple Points each, by clicking on the [Purchase Morning Light] or [Purchase Star Light] buttons from the Morning Starlight Harvest UI.
      • Purchase count accumulates throughout the event.

    Note

      • After defeating Lotus (Hard) or a higher difficulty boss, Sol Erda Energy is dropped by defeating the boss loot box.
      • The stats, Monster Collection Capture Chance Increase and Bonus coins upon completing Legion weekly missions perks, cannot be activated in Challenger World.
      • The Arcane River Daily Mission Rewards and Grandis Daily Mission Rewards skill effects are applied once a day in each world and are applied when first completing a daily mission.
        • If you decline, you can still claim the reward with another character in the same world after completing the quest or a different daily quest.
      • The Arcane River and Grandis Daily Mission Reward skills offer an EXP boost and bonus Symbol distribution. These perks can be selectively applied to different characters and daily quests when you complete them.
      • The Arcane River Daily Mission Reward skill only applies the EXP boost perk upon completing a daily quest in the Tenebris area.
      • The Grandis Daily Mission Rewards skill only applies to Cernium, Hotel Arcus, Odium, Shangri-La, Arteria, Carcion, and Tallahart area daily quests.
      • You cannot get the additional rewards for daily quests that are already completed before activating the skill effect.
      • Legion Coins that are obtained from the Bonus coins upon completing Legion weekly missions perk do not apply to Legion Coin related achievements.

    Back to Top

    Memento Coin Exchange

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Shop availability: June 11 (after maintenance) - August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who participated in the ‘Morning Star Feast’ or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    Check out what ya’ll can get with the Memento Coins that you earned from completing the weekly check-in!

    How to Participate

    • Access the Memento Coin Exchange through Tia located at the Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens.
    • The amount of Memento Coins obtained and used, are shared with all characters within the account.

    • Coupons/items located in your Use tab are used in order of placement in the tab. Please check to see if they're placed in order of expiration before use.
    • If you have an empty scroll bag in your Use inventory, it will be distributed to your scroll bag when you purchase scrolls such as 'Karma Powerful/ Eternal/ Black Rebirth Flame'.
    • Character Slot Expansion Coupon cannot be purchased if the character slots are maxed out, but there is no limit on purchase if the character slots are not maxed out.
      • Multiple Character Slot Expansion Coupons can be purchased, but they can only be used one at a time. Make sure to check your current number of character slots before purchasing because you won’t be able to use them once you’re maxed out.
    • Extreme Growth Potion cannot be used by burning characters, and can only be used by characters Lv.130 and above. When used by characters Lv. 200 and above, they will obtain EXP needed to level up to Lv. 199.
    • Legendary Circulator cannot be used on Legendary grade abilities.
    • Challenger World exclusive Extreme Growth Potion item can be used with Tera Burning characters created in Challenger World.
    ⚠️ Memento Coin Exchange Shop will be CLOSED on August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC

    Back to Top

    Victory Badge Exchange

    June 29 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Shop availability: June 11 (after maintenance) - August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    Have ya’ll been doing your weekly bosses?! Well I hope you are because once you defeat your bosses, you can earn Victory and Special Badges to exchange for various rewards! Easy gains.

    How to Participate

    • Select ‘Victory Badge Exchange’ from the Event List UI and click ‘Participate’ to begin.
      • Alternatively, you can Access the Victory Badge Exchange by talking to Mallon located at the Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens.

    How to Obtain Victory Badges

    • Defeat weekly bosses to earn Victory Badges or Special Victory Badges. The number of badges you can claim depends on the boss’s difficulty.
      • Weekly boss defeats only count when in a solo party or not in a party at all.
      • You can also claim Victory and Special Victory Badge when taking on a boss in practice mode.
      • Players who reach the death count limit or leave the battle before the boss is defeated won’t be eligible to receive badges.
    • After defeating a weekly boss, talk to Mallon to claim your Victory Badges.
    • Each week, you can claim up to 2,000 Victory Badges and 50 Special Victory Badges per account.
      • The badges can only be used within the world where they are obtained in.
      • Victory and Special Victory Badges can only be earned during the event period.
    • If you have already claimed Victory or Special Victory Badges this week and you defeat a boss in another world that gives more badges, you’ll be able to claim the difference between the two amounts.
      • Example 1: You claimed 600 badges for defeating Normal Lotus in World A, then defeated Easy Lucid in World B, which gives 900 badges. You’ll receive 300 additional badges which is the difference between the two boss rewards.
      • Example 2: You claimed 600 badges for defeating Normal Lotus in World A, then defeated Normal Lotus again in World B. No additional badges will be granted since the boss and reward amount are the same.
    • Victory Badges and Special Victory Badges can be earned from the following bosses:
    Victory Badge Distribution
    Weekly Boss Victory Badge Quantity
    Easy Cygnus 10
    Hard Hilla 50
    Chaos Pink Bean

    Victory Badge and Special Victory Badge records reset every Thursday at 12:00 AM UTC

    • Exchange your Victory Badges and Special Victory Badges at the Victory Badge Exchange Shop for items that help your character grow.

    Meso Shop

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Shop Availability: June 11 (after maintenance) - August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who participated in the ‘Morning Star Feast’ or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    Check out all the goodies you can purchase through the Meso Shop within the Morning Star Banquet event hub!

    How to Participate

    • Access the Meso Shop through Nia located at the Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens.

    Meso Shop Items

    Item Price Quantity Limit

    Back to Top

    Story of Servants

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who participated in the ‘Morning Star Feast’ or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    It’s time for us to clock in and work at our new job as an attendant! Complete all of the attendant duties with servant Kieran to receive hidden rewards!

    How to Participate

    • Select ‘Story of Servants’ from the Event List UI and click ‘Participate’ to begin.
      • Alternatively, you can talk to Kieran located in Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens and complete the [Servant Story] Story of Servants’ quest.
    • Upon completing the [Servant Story] Story of Servants quest, you can obtain the ‘Morning Star Display Case’ once per account.
    • Chat with Kieran to get hints for other various achievements that you can complete during the Morning Star Banquet event period!

    Back to Top

    Banquet’s Blessing

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who completed ‘Gob’s Call’ quest or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    Are ya’ll too busy to grind for some EXP? Count your blessings, Maplers! Join our Banquet’s Blessing to get that EXP bar goin’ easy peasy.

    How to Participate

    • Every 5 seconds you can obtain EXP based on your level once you enter Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens.
    • Once the event period is over, you will not be able to obtain the EXP within Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens.

    Back to Top

    Breumi’s Clean Up

    June 11 (after maintenance) - July 15 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who participated in the ‘Morning Star Banquet’ event or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    It’s getting a little dusty here, so let’s help Breumi Clean Up!

    How to Participate

    • Select ‘Breumi’s Clean Up’ from the Event List UI and click ‘Participate’ to begin.
      • Alternatively, you can talk to Breumi located in Imperial Villa: Hanging Gardens to start.
    • Once you talk with Breumi, you will obtain the 'Sweep Sweep’ skill.
    • Your gauge will fill once you defeat 300 monsters near your level (20 levels above and 20 levels below) with the Sweep Sweep skill active.
      • This skill is automatically activated when you enter the hunting zones.
    • When the gauge is full, ‘Breumi’s Exciting Clean Up’ skill is activated and a generous amount of EXP is given.

    Back to Top

    Burning Events

    Hyper Burning MAX

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Characters that meet one of the below criteria.

    1. Characters who were newly created during the event period
    2. Existing Lv. 200 - 258 character (For Zero character, one must be Lv. 200 - 258 and must have completed Story Quest Act 2)
    3. Sia Astelle characters cannot participate in Hyper Burning MAX.

    How to Set Up Hyper Burning MAX Character

    • Click ‘Set as Hyper Burning MAX’ to create your Hyper Burning MAX Character.
    • Challenger World UI

    • Interactive and Heroic Worlds UI

    Hyper Burning MAX Character Perks

    • 1+4 Level-up
      • Hyper Burning MAX characters can gain 4 extra levels for each level up from Lv. 10 to 260.
        • Levels from Lv. 1-10 will only increase by 1.
      • Zero characters will level up by 1 before Lv. 200, and can receive 1+4 level up perk after Lv. 200.
    • Level-Up Support rewards are distributed to all Hyper Burning MAX characters
      • You can get all of the following rewards by clicking the START button from the Hyper Burning MAX event UI.
      • NOTE:
        • Zero characters cannot use the Frozen Weapon Box & Frozen Secondary Weapon Box within the Legendary Cryptic Chest, or the 15-Star Fafnir Weapon Box within the 15-Star Root Abyss Set Box (Time-Restricted).
        • For existing characters that already have the Eternal Flame Ring, cannot use the coupon.
    • Reach the level achievements as a Hyper Burning MAX character and obtain rewards!
      • You can get an even more enhanced level achievement reward in Challenger World.
      • When an existing character is set as Hyper Burning MAX, you cannot claim the level rewards for levels you already reached.
        • For example, when a Lv. 235 character is set as Hyper Burning MAX, you cannot claim the level rewards for Levels 200 - 235.

    Level Achievement Support Rewards

    Level Interactive and Heroic Worlds Rewards Challenger Worlds Rewards
    Create Character Mysterious Cryptic Chest: Untradable, expires August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC.

    Open to receive:

    • Snail Pet: Untradable, 30-day duration.

    • The items you get when using the Abyss Hunter Ring Coupon are permanent and are Tradable once within same account and world once.
    • The items you get when using the Infinite Flame Title Coupon are permanent and untradable, 60-day stat duration.

    Back to Top

    Tera Blink

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Newly created characters Lv. 10 and above that have been registered as Hyper Burning MAX characters or new Hyper Burning MAX Zero characters created after June 11, 2025 that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    How to Participate

    • Accept the ‘[Tera Blink] World Inside the Hat’ quest from Event List UI or talk to Spiegelmann located in Henesys or Nameless Town.
    • After completing the ‘[Tera Blink] World Inside the Hat’ quest, speak to Spiegelmann to move to the map.
      • You can stay up to 40 minutes at one time in the event map.
      • You can freely enter and exit the event map by talking to NPC Spiegelmann.
    • All skill and buff effects given through the mission are collected and removed when you exit the event map.

    Tera Blink: World Inside the Hat

    • There are 23 missions within the World Inside the Hat.
    • Clearing each mission gives a large amount of EXP and some will reward items as well.
    • Note: Characters such as Cadena, Ark, and Illium will not be able to earn EXP in the World Inside the Hat if they have not completed their job tutorial quests.

    Tera Blink Rewards

    Completing Spiegelmann's Missions

    • Spiegelmann's Power Elixir x1000: Untradable, Permanent.
    • Dazzling Hat (Pet): Untradable, Permanent, 90-day magic duration.
    • Dazzling Hat's Aura (Pet Equipment): Untradable, Permanent.
    • Spiegelmann's Hat Chair: Tradable within world, Permanent.
    • Spiegelmann's Dazzling Hat Effect: Untradable, Permanent.

    Back to Top

    Item Burning

    June 11 (after maintenance) - November 11 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 200 and above characters that completed ‘A Greater Power’ or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    Make sure your equipment is just as strong as you are with Item Burning!

    How to Participate

    • Select ‘Get your Item Burning Box’ from the Event List UI and click ‘Participate’ to begin.
    • Receive up to 8 kinds of Challenger Equipment for your character when you use the Item Burning Box.
      • The Item Burning Box is tradable within worlds but the equipment obtained when the box is opened is untradable.
    • After receiving your equipment, you can try the level achievement missions and boss defeat missions!
      • Your progress for these missions can be viewed from the Event List.

    Challenger Equipment

    • Eight (8) types of equipment depending on your job will be distributed.
      • Challenger Weapon
      • Hat
      • Top
      • Bottom
      • Gloves
      • Shoes
      • Cape
      • Shoulder Accessory
    • For Zero characters only, the ‘Apply’ button will appear on the Item Burning UI to apply Lapis/Lazuli Challenger Equipment Set Effect when another equipment Set Effect is applied.
      • If the Lapis/Lazuli Challenger Equipment Set Effect is already applied to the Zero character, the Lapis/Lazuli Challenger Equipment Set application button is deactivated.
      • Bonus Stats for the distributed equipment items are granted as predetermined stats that correspond with each character's Job, and restrictions apply for Item Drop, Sell, Extract, Scroll use, Star Force enhancement, Transfer Hammer, Equipment Transmission, Bonus Stats resetting, and Potential resetting.
      • The distributed Challenger Equipment have the following enhancement/potential applied.
    Stage Level Mission Reward Interactive World Perks Heroic World Perks
    1 200 Defeat Zakum (Chaos) solo Challenger Equipment Perk 1
    • Bonus Stats rank-up
    • Scroll Enhancement value level-up
    • Zenon Armor is replaced and enhanced to All Stats Scroll.
    • Bonus Stats rank-up
    2 210 Defeat Vellum (Chaos) solo Challenger Equipment Perk 2
    • Bonus Stats rank-up
    • Grant Bonus Potential
    • Bonus Stats rank-up
    3 220 Defeat Papulatus (Chaos) solo Challenger Equipment Perk 3
    • Level up to Star Force 17
    • Level up to Star Force 17
    4 225 Defeat Lotus (Normal) solo Challenger Equipment Perk 4
    • Level up rank to Unique Potential
    • Level up rank to Unique Potential
    5 230 Guardian Angel Slime (Normal) solo Challenger Equipment Perk 5
    • Level up to Star Force 18
    • Scroll Enhancement value level-up
    • Level up to Star Force 18
    6 260 Defeat Lucid (Easy) solo Challenger Equipment Perk 6
    • Armor Bonus Potential increase to Epic
    • Weapon Bonus Potential increase to Unique
    • Level up to Star Force 19

    Back to Top

    Challenger World

    June 11 (after maintenance) - September 24 at 2:00 PM UTC

    Challenger World Mission: June 11 (after maintenance) - September 23 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: New characters created in Challenger World during the event period.

    Challenger World has officially made its way to Global MapleStory! It’s now available in both Interactive AND Heroic Worlds with their usual World perks and restrictions still in effect. Think of it as Burning World but more rewards, faster growth, and now available to everyone!

    How to Participate

    • Choose to play in either Challenger-Heroic or Challenger-Interactive. Both follow the same perks, restrictions, prices, and systems as their respective world counterparts.
      • New accounts created in Challenger-Heroic will not receive the Heroic Gift Box. This reward is exclusive to Kronos and Hyperion Heroic servers.
    • Once a Challenger World is chosen, all characters created there can only be played within that same world. You cannot switch or create characters in the other Challenger World.
      • For example: If your first character was created in Challenger-Heroic, you will still not be able to access Challenger-Interactive even if all characters are deleted. So choose carefully!!!
    • Up to 5 characters can be created in Challenger World.
      • Character Slot Expansion Coupons cannot be used.
    • After the Challenger World event ends, all characters will be automatically moved to the Challenger Leap Zone and the following will be unavailable:
      • Character Growth Items
      • Cash Inventory
      • Auction House
      • Delivery Package Storage

    Challenger World Perks and Rewards

    1. All Challenger World characters receive a special Challenger Skill, which is automatically removed upon World Leap:
      • EXP obtained increased to 1.5x rate.
      • +50 ATT/Magic ATT
      • Normal Enemy Damage +30%
      • Boss Damage +30%
      • Ignore Defense +30%
      • Critical Rate +30%
      • Critical Damage +30%
      • Buff Duration +30%
      • Knockback Resistance +100%
      • All Stats +50
      • Max HP & MP +2500
    2. In the Maple Guide recommended hunting zones for Lv. 259 and below, maps are instanced for each player and up to 10 per map.
      • In Grandis maps, up to 8 players can share the same map.
    3. Upon creation, Challenger characters can claim starter gear by clicking the ‘Claim Creation Reward’ button in the event UI. Each of the 5 Challenger characters can claim the rewards once and deleting a character will not reset the reward limit. Receive the following:
      • Pearl Maple Armor Set Box: Untradable, 7-day duration.
        • Pearl Maple Hat: Untradable, Permanent.
        • Pearl Maple Suit: Untradable, Permanent.
        • Pearl Maple Cape: Untradable, Permanent.
        • Pearl Maple Gum: Untradable, Permanent.
        • Pearl Maple Pendant: Untradable, Permanent.
        • Pearl Maple Buckle: Untradable, Permanent.
      • Power Elixir x1000: Untradable, Permanent.
      • Spell Trace x1000: Tradable, Permanent.
    4. The free gains don’t stop there because you can create up to 3 Tera Burning characters to level from 10-200 and gain 2 levels per level-up! Claim Tera Burning rewards by clicking the ‘Claim Your Tera Burning Gift!’ button in the event UI to receive the following:
      • Mysterious Cryptic Chest: Untradable, 7-day duration.
        • Snail Pet: Untradable, 30-day duration.
      • Lv. 30 Equipment Box: Untradable, expires September 24 at 2:00 PM UTC.
        • Level 30 Equipment: Untradable, Permanent.
      • Legendary Cryptic Chest: Untradable, expires September 24 at 2:00 PM UTC.
        • Frozen Hat: Untradable, Permanent.
        • Frozen Cape: Untradable, Permanent.
        • Frozen Suit: Untradable, Permanent.
        • Frozen Weapon Box: Untradable, 7-day duration.
        • Frozen Secondary Weapon Box: Untradable, 7-day duration.
      • Root Abyss Set Box (Time-Restricted): Untradable, expires September 24 at 2:00 PM UTC.
        • Root Abyss Hat: Untradable, 90-day duration.
        • Root Abyss Top: Untradable, 90-day duration.
        • Root Abyss Bottom: Untradable, 90-day duration.
        • Fafnir Weapon Box (Time-Restricted): : Untradable, 7-day duration.
      • Eternal Flame Title Coupon: Untradable, expires September 24 at 2:00 PM UTC.
        • Eternal Flame: Untradable, Permanent.

    Challenger World Missions

    • Participate in multiple Challenger World Missions by selecting ‘Challenger World’ from the Event List UI and clicking ‘Participate’ to begin.
    • Rewards that are unlocked can be claimed until September 23, 2025 11:59 PM UTC.

    • Hunting Mission
      • Defeat 1,000 enemies near your level (20 levels above and 20 levels below), then click the ‘[Mission Complete]’ button within the Challenger World UI to complete a Hunting Mission and receive 100 Challenger Points and 300 Challenger Coins.
      • The Hunting Mission can be done once a day and up to 5 times a week per account.
      • Missed a daily hunting mission? Use 3,000 Maple Points to complete a missed daily hunting mission.
    • Level Mission
      • Reach specific level milestones with your Challenger World character for Challenger Points and Coins. Open the Challenger World UI to automatically complete the Level Mission.
    Level Reached Challenger Points Given Challenger Coins Given
    260 1000 1000
    265 2000 2000
    270 3000 3000
    275 5000 4000
    280 7000 5000
    • Boss Mission
      • Defeat specific bosses with your Challenger World character for Challenger Points and Coins. Open the Challenger World UI to automatically complete the Boss Mission.
    Defeat Boss Challenger Points Given Challenger Coins Given
    Easy Cygnus 50 50
    Hard Hilla
    Chaos Pink Bean 100 100
    Normal Cygnus
    Chaos Zakum
    Chaos Pierre
    Chaos Von Bon
    Chaos Crimson Queen
    Hard Magnus 200
    Chaos Vellum
    Chaos Papulatus 250
    Normal Lotus 350
    Normal Damien
    Normal Guardian Angel Slime 500
    Easy Lucid
    Easy Will
    Normal Lucid 1000 200
    Normal Will
    Normal Gloom
    Normal Darknell
    Hard Lotus 1500
    Hard Damien
    Hard Lucid 2000 300
    Normal Verus Hilla
    Hard Will 2500
    Chaos Guardian Angel Slime
    Chaos Gloom
    Hard Verus Hilla 3000 500
    Hard Darknell

    Challenger World Tier Rewards

    • The amount of Challenger Points you own determines your Tier. Earn Challenger Points from completing Challenger World Missions to increase your Tier Rank and unlock even more rewards.
    • Reaching the Emerald Tier and above allows characters in the same world outside of Challenger World to also claim the rewards.
      • For example, if playing on Challenger-Interactive, characters in Scania, Bera, Aurora, and Elysium can claim them!
    • Additional rewards can be claimed as you reach higher Challenger Tiers, but the rewards may vary depending on the world where they are claimed.
      • The Ultimate Legion Growth Potion reward displays an additional reward agreement window only in Hyperion and Kronos worlds.
      • If the rewards are claimed in Hyperion, the quantity of Ultimate Legion Growth obtained increases from 10 to 15. When accepted, the reward cannot be claimed in Challenger-Heroic or Kronos.
    Points Earned/Tier Reward Item
    5,000
    Bronze
    • Challenger World Season 1 - Bronze Medal Coupon: Tradable within world, expires September 24 at 2:00 PM UTC.

      Use to receive:

      • Challenger World Season 1 Bronze: Untradable, Permanent.

    • Sol Erda Fragment x100: Untradable, Permanent.
    • Sol Erda x3: Tradable within world, expires September 24 at 2:00 PM UTC.
    • Fairy Heart: Untradable, Permanent.
    10,000
    Silver
    • Challenger World Season 1 - Silver Medal Coupon: Tradable within world, expires September 24 at 2:00 PM UTC.

    Use to receive:

      • Challenger World Season 1 Silver: Untradable, Permanent.

    • Sol Erda Fragment x200: Untradable, Permanent.
    • Sol Erda x5: Tradable within world, expires September 24 at 2:00 PM UTC.

    Gold

    Challenger World Leap

    • There will be two Challenger World Leap events for Challenger World characters:
      • 1st Challenger World Leap: August 27 (after maintenance) - September 23 at 11:59 PM UTC
      • 2nd Challenger World Leap: September 24 (after maintenance) - October 16 at 11:59 PM UTC
    • The Challenger World event will end September 23 at 11:59 PM UTC. All characters after this date, will be moved to the leap zone.

    World Leap Details

    • Only characters Lv. 130 and above and up to 5 characters can World Leap.
    • If there are no open character slots, one will be added automatically.
      • If your character slots are full, you cannot World Leap.
    • The following items will not transfer:
      • Items and Mesos in Cash Inventory, Auction House, or Delivery Package
      • Background obtained from coupons, unless extracted through the Mover NPC and transferred when leaping.
    • Characters cannot transfer if:
      • They’re in or requesting to join a guild.
      • They are the Guild Master.
    • Event coins and shared skills will carry over to the destination world.
    • Characters that are not transferred by the World Leap deadline will be deleted.
    • Characters with the following items in their inventory cannot World Leap
      • Mystical Cube
      • Karma Solid Cube
      • Karma Bonus Mystical Cube
      • Karma Star Force 17-Star Enhancement (Lv. 160)
      • Challenger Lv. 4 Special Skill Ring Selector Coupon
      • Challenger Ring of Restraint
      • Challenger Continuous Ring
      • Challenger Weapon Jump S Ring
      • Challenger Weapon Jump D Ring
      • Challenger Weapon Jump I Ring
      • Challenger Weapon Jump L Ring

    Back to Top

    Other Events

    Hyperion World Leap

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters created before June 11 at 12:00 AM UTC and Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    The high population in Kronos has recently brought about technical challenges and difficulties in maintaining a stable and comfortable gaming environment. In an effort to provide this, we have prepared a special event allowing players to leap from Kronos to Hyperion.

    How to Participate

    • Talk with NPC Mover in Henesys or click on World Leap from your Event UI to participate in World Leap.
      • World Leap is only available for characters in Kronos to Hyperion.
      • Characters in Hyperion cannot World Leap.

    • You can transfer your Legion progress when leaping worlds by creating a Legion Leap Box.
    • After checking in with our Maple Admin for specific details of transferring, you can proceed by clicking ‘yes’ then selecting the world you would like to transfer to.
    • Upon your selection, you will be moved to the login window where you can re-connect to the world and confirm your character transfer.
    • Key details on how you can prepare for a smooth transfer can be found HERE

    Hyperion World Perks

    June 11 (after maintenance) - June 14 at 11:59 PM UTC

    • +100% Rune EXP buff effect (3x normal EXP)
    • +300% Combo Kill EXP
    • 2x EXP for Pollo, Fritto, and Especia Bounty Hunting
    • 2x Inferno Wolf Exit EXP
    • 2x chance for new Monster Collection monsters
    • 1.5x Item Drop Rate

    Back to Top

    Summer’s Guide

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters or Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2.

    How to Participate

    • Select the ‘Summer Tutorial Mission’ from the Event List and click ‘Participate’ to start.
    • You can view your progress by clicking on ‘Summer Tutorial Mission’ from the Event List!
    • Each mission in the ‘Summer Tutorial Mission’ can be started at specific levels, and you can proceed by following the guidance from Spiegelette.
      • Once you have completed a mission, you can claim your rewards and move onto the next mission!

    Summer's Guide Rewards

    Use to choose one of the following:

    • VIP Buff (EXP): Tradable within world, 1-day duration.
    • VIP Buff (Stats): Tradable within world, 1-day duration.

    Use to choose one of the following:

    • Sayram's Elixir: Untradable, 7-day duration.
    • Aurelia's Elixir: Untradable, 7-day duration.
    260 HEXA Matrix Complete 6th Job Advancement Sol Erda Energy x1: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC.
    Sacred Power Reach Sacred Power 20 Sacred Symbol Selector x1 Coupon x10: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC.
    Monster Park Extreme Clear Monster Park Extreme 1 Time First Steps Bottom Shell Coupon: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC.

    Use to receive:

    • First Steps Bottom Shell: Untradable, Permanent.
    Epic Dungeon Clear Epic Dungeon 1 Time Karma Black Rebirth Flame x5: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC.
    Auto-Harvest Clear Auto-Harvest Quest 3x EXP Coupon (30 min) x2: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC.
    Familiars Clear Familiar Quest I Totally Get It Medal Coupon x1: Tradable within world, expires August 27 at 2:00 PM UTC.

    Use to receive:

    • I Totally Get It Medal: Untradable, Permanent.

    Note

    • The ‘Summer Tutorial Mission’ participation records are shared with all characters within the account.
    • Rewards from each mission can only be claimed once per account.
    • You can select either the VIP Buff (Stats) or VIP Buff (EXP) upon using the VIP Buff Selector Coupon.
    • The selected VIP Buff can only be transferred between your characters within the same world and expires in 1-day.
    • The Legendary Elixir Coupon can be used by a Lv. 200+ character when there is a character that cleared the [Collector's Request] quest, and you can obtain the Sayram's Elixir and Aurelia's Elixir upon use.
    • Sayram's Elixir and Aurelia's Elixir obtained from the Legendary Elixir Coupon are untradable, and expire in 7 days.
    • Items obtained by using First Steps Follower, First Steps Wings, First Steps Top Shell, First Steps Bottom Shell Coupons are untradable and permanent.
    ⚠️ Summer's Guide Rewards can only be claimed from June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Back to Top

    Luxe Sauna

    June 11 (after maintenance) - August 26 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    How to Participate

    • Use a Luxe Sauna Coupon to charge the Luxe Sauna room time!
      • Luxe Sauna Coupon: Tradable within world, 7-day duration.
      • The use duration for the Luxe Sauna is recharged for 1 hour by using 3,000 Maple Points in the 'Use the Luxe Sauna' from the Event List.
      • Each coupon extends the time by 30 minutes and the charge time cannot exceed the event durations remaining time.
      • Coupons can only be used during the event period.
      • After the event period ends, you cannot obtain EXP even if there is time remaining for Luxe Sauna.
        • Luxe Sauna can be recharged for up to 24 hours in 1 week.
        • Luxe Sauna recharge count is reset every Thursday at 12:00 PM UTC.

    • Once the Luxe Sauna room is charged, either talk to the Hotel Receptionist in Sleepywood Hotel or click 'Use the Luxe Sauna' from the Event List and press the 'Participate' button to enter the Luxe Sauna Room.
      • You will not have access to the Luxe Sauna room if there are no charges.
    • While in the Luxe Sauna Room, receive EXP based on your level every 5 seconds.
      • Lv. 289 and above characters receive the same amount of EXP obtained at Lv. 289.
      • Burning characters can also participate in the event and receive EXP.

    • The Luxe Sauna charge time is shared among all characters in the same account and only decreases while in the Luxe Sauna Room..
      • The time will not decrease when you leave the game.
    • Check the remaining time by viewing the sign inside the Luxe Sauna Room.
    • You’ll be automatically removed from the map when there are no more charges.

    Back to Top

    Hit the Road

    Participation Gift Claim Period: May 28 - June 10 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Preparation Gift Claim Period: June 11 (after maintenance) - June 24 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    It’s time to Hit The Road and head on out to some awesome rewards!

    How to Participate

    • Accept and complete the '[Hit the Road] Precursor Event' quest by talking to Ms. Song located in the Event Hall or selecting it from the Event UI.
      • This will unlock the Hit The Road UI for participation.
    • Defeat 1,000 monsters within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above) and click the ‘Participate’ button to receive attendance rewards and Participation Gift rewards based on the amount of times you have participated in the event.
      • Each participation can be completed once a day and participation records are shared between all characters per account.
      • The Participation button resets every day at 12:00 AM UTC.
      • Monster defeats only count when in a solo party or not in a party at all.
    • For 3,000 Maple Points, you can use the Hit the Road Pass to complete a missed participation.
      • The total number of missed participations and Hit the Road Passes available for purchase can be seen through the Event UI.
      • The Pass can only be purchased until June 10th at 11:59 PM UTC and will not be available after this date.
    • Preparation Gift rewards are completed alongside Participation Gift rewards but can only be claimed during their respective event period.
      • Participation Gift rewards can be claimed during: May 28th at 12:00 AM UTC - June 10th at 11:59 PM UTC
      • Preparation Gift rewards can be claimed during: June 11th (after maintenance) - June 24th at 11:59 PM UTC

    Participation Rewards

    Miracle Time

    June 14 at 12:00 AM UTC - August 23 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    How to Participate

    • Your equipment upgrade success rate will be increased every other Saturday!
    • Miracle Time applies to Cash Cubes that rank up the Potential, including:
    • Glowing Cube, Bright Cube, Bonus Glowing Cube, Bonus Bright Cube, Violet Cube and Cube of Equality.
    • Keep an eye out for a notification during Miracle Time! A notice will be visible during this event period to inform you that Miracle Time is in progress.
    Miracle Time Schedule
    Date Time UTC Items
    June 14, 2025 12:00 AM - 11:59 PM
    • Hat
    June 28, 2025 12:00 AM - 11:59 PM
    • Top
    • Bottom

    Sunny Sunday

    Log in each Sunday during the event duration to enjoy various perks!

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    Sunny Sunday Schedule
    Date (UTC) Perks
    June 15, 2025
    • +250% Monster Park Clear EXP
      • Excludes Monster Park Extreme and Morning Starlight Harvest

    • Combo Kill EXP + 300%
